editorialDecl.p: EEBO-TCP is a partnership between the Universities of Michigan and Oxford and the publisher ProQuest to create accurately transcribed and encoded texts based on the image sets published by ProQuest via their Early English Books Online (EEBO) database (http://eebo.chadwyck.com). The general aim of EEBO-TCP is to encode one copy (usually the first edition) of every monographic English-language title published between 1473 and 1700 available in EEBO.

EEBO-TCP aimed to produce large quantities of textual data within the usual project restraints of time and funding, and therefore chose to create diplomatic transcriptions (as opposed to critical editions) with light-touch, mainly structural encoding based on the Text Encoding Initiative (http://www.tei-c.org).

The EEBO-TCP project was divided into two phases. The 25,363 texts created during Phase 1 of the project have been released into the public domain as of 1 January 2015. Anyone can now take and use these texts for their own purposes, but we respectfully request that due credit and attribution is given to their original source.
Users should be aware of the process of creating the TCP texts, and therefore of any assumptions that can be made about the data.

Text selection was based on the New Cambridge Bibliography of English Literature (NCBEL). If an author (or for an anonymous work, the title) appears in NCBEL, then their works are eligible for inclusion. Selection was intended to range over a wide variety of subject areas, to reflect the true nature of the print record of the period. In general, first editions of a works in English were prioritized, although there are a number of works in other languages, notably Latin and Welsh, included and sometimes a second or later edition of a work was chosen if there was a compelling reason to do so.

Image sets were sent to external keying companies for transcription and basic encoding. Quality assurance was then carried out by editorial teams in Oxford and Michigan. 5% (or 5 pages, whichever is the greater) of each text was proofread for accuracy and those which did not meet QA standards were returned to the keyers to be redone. After proofreading, the encoding was enhanced and/or corrected and characters marked as illegible were corrected where possible up to a limit of 100 instances per text. Any remaining illegibles were encoded as <gap>s. Understanding these processes should make clear that, while the overall quality of TCP data is very good, some errors will remain and some readable characters will be marked as illegible. Users should bear in mind that in all likelihood such instances will never have been looked at by a TCP editor.
The texts were encoded and linked to page images in accordance with level 4 of the TEI in Libraries guidelines.

Copies of the texts have been issued variously as SGML (TCP schema; ASCII text with mnemonic sdata character entities); displayable XML (TCP schema; characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or text strings within braces); or lossless XML (TEI P5, characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or TEI g elements).

Full documentation of the original data capture process is available from the Text Creation Partnership web site. All versions of the texts are now archived and freely available for download. See the TCP Download FAQ for detailed information. The TEI P5 versions are also freely available from the TCP Github repository.

div.p: ¶ ANNO. III. & IIII. EDVVARDI SEXTI. ❧ ACTES ❧ made in the Session of this present Parlament, holden vpon prorogation at Westmynster, the .iiii. daye of Nouembre, in the thirde yere of the reygne of our most dread Souereygne Lorde Edward the .vi. by the grace of God, kyng of Englande, Fraunce, and Ireland, defendour of the fayth, and of the Churche of Englande, and also of Irelande, in earth the supreme head: and there continued, and kept to the first daye of Februarye, in the .iiii. yere of the reigne of our sayed Souereigne Lorde, as foloweth.

div.head: The table.

list.item: AN Acte that the Lorde Chauncellour, or Lorde keper of the great Seale, for the time being, shal name, and appoint the Custos rotulorum, throughout all Shires of Englande according as in time past hath ben accustomed. Chap. i.
An acte for the true making of Woullen clothes. Chap. ii.
An acte concerning emprouement of Commons, and Wast groundes. Chap. iii.
An acte concerning grauntes, and giftes made by patentees, out of lettres patentes. Chap. iiii.
An acte for the punishmēt of vnlawful assemblies, and rising of the Kinges Subiectes. Chap. v.
An acte, concerning the repeale of a braunche in the acte of parlament made for buying of tanned Leather. Chap. vi.
An acte for the repeale of a Statute made in the .xxv. yere of king Hēry the .viii. touching the takyng of wyld foule at certayne times of the yere. Chap. vii.
An acte for the continuaunce of the Statute of Sewers. Chap. viii.
An acte for the buying of rawe hydes, and calf skinnes. Chap. ix.
An acte for the abolishing, & putting away of diuers bookes, & ymages. Chap. x.
An acte that the kinges Maiestie may nominate, and appoynct .xxxii. persons to peruse, and make Ecclesiasticall lawes. Chap. xi.
An acte for the ordryng of Ecclesiasticall ministers. Chap. xii.
An acte for the restitutiō in bloud of Syr William Sharington knight. Chap. xiii
An acte for the restitucion in bloud of Marye Seymour daughter to Syr Thomas Seymour knyght, Lorde Seymour of Sudleye, late Admirall of Englande. Chap. xiiii.
An acte against fonde, and phantasticall prophecies Chap. xv.
An acte touching the punishment of vagabondes, & other idle persones. Chap. xvi.
An acte agaynst vnlawfull hunting in any Parke, Forrest, Chase, or other enclosed grounde. Chap. xvii.
An acte concerning Fee fermes, mencioned in the last Session. Chap. xviii.
An acte for the buying of rother beastes, and cattall. Chap. xix
An acte touching the repeale of a certayne braūche of an acte passed in the last Sessiō of this Parlament, cōcerning victuallers, and artificers. Chap. xx.
An acte for the buying, and sellyng of butter, and chese. Chap. xxi.
An acte touching the reteyning of iourneymen, by dyuers persons. Chap. xxii.
An acte concerning the release of the branches in the last act of relief, for the payementes of Shepe, and Clothes, and also a graunte of a Subsidie to be paied in one yere. Chap. xxiii.
An acte of the kinges maiesties most free, and generall perdone. Chap. xxiiii.

div.head: ¶ An Acte, that the Lorde Chauncellour, or Lorde keeper of the great seale for the tyme beyng, shall name and appoynct the Custos rotulorum throughout all shyres of England, according as in time past hath been accustomed. ¶ The first Chapitre.
div.p:
WHere in the parlament holden at westmynster in the .xxxvii. yere of the reigne of the most excellent prynce of famouse memorye kyng Henrye the .viii. it was enacted that no persone, or persones, shoulde from the makyng of the sayed act be nominated, and appoynted to thoffice, or offices of the Custos rotulorum, within any shyre of this realme of Englande, Wales, or other the kynges dominions, marches, or territories of the same, but suche as shoulde haue a byll signed with the Kinges hande for the same, whiche byll sygned, shoulde bee a sufficient warraunt by aucthoritie of the sayed act, to the Lord Chauncelour of Englande, and Lorde keeper of the great seale, for the tyme beyng, to make from tyme to tyme, commyssion or commissions, assygnyng, and aucthorising therby, the same person to be Custos rotulorum, vntill the kyng had by another byll assigned with his owne hand appoynted, & ordeyned an other persone, to haue, occupie, and exercyse the same office of Custos rotulorum, and that the sayed persone appoynted, and assygned to be Custos rotulorum, as is abouesaid, should, & might occupie, exercise, end enioye the sayd office of Custos rotulorum, by him selfe, or by hys sufficient deputie learned in the lawes of thys realme, & meete, and hable to supplye the sayed office, accordyng to the tenour of the sayed graunt, or cōmission, as by the same act emong other thinges more at large it doth, and may appere. Sence the making of which statute, diuerse & many persons being in the sayed offices of Custos rotulorum, in diuers shires of the realme, haue departed this present lyfe, and dyed, so that there hath not come to the handes of the chauncelour of England, or Lord keeper of the great seale, anye byll, or billes assigned with the kinges maiesties hand for the naming, appointing, or assigning of any newe Custos rotulorum in the same shyres, the sayed offices haue remayned voyde for a long tyme, to the great let of Iustice. And also for that it shalbe very tedious, and muche to the molestyng of the Kynges Maiestie vpon euery auoydaunce of suche Custos rotulorum, by death, or otherwyse, to moue his Maiestie for the signyng of bylles for other persons to be elected, named, chosen, and appoynted to supplye the sayed offices of Custos rotulorum, being voyde. And for that the nomination and appointing of the sayed office of Custos rotulorum, long tyme before the
makyng of the sayed Statute last before rehearsed dyd apperteyne, and belong to the office of the Chauncellour of Englande, or Lorde keeper of the great seale for the tyme being: Be it therfore enacted by the kyng our souereygne Lorde, with the assent of the Lordes spirituall and temporall, and the Commons in this present parlament assembled, and by the aucthoritie of the same: that the Chauncellour of Englande, or lorde keper of the great seale, for the tyme being, shall at all tyme, and tymes herafter, and from time to time, without any bill, or billes to be assigned with the kinges hande, name, elect, assigne, and appoynct such person, & persons to be Custos rotulorum, within euerye shyre of thys realme of Englande, Wales, and other the kinges dominiōs, Marches, & territories of the same, or by anye of them, as by the dyscrecion of the sayed Lorde Chauncellour, or Lorde keeper of the great seale, for the tyme beyng, shalbe thought hable, and meete to haue and exercise the same. And that the sayed persone, and persones, so to be appoincted, elected, named, and assygned by the sayed Lord Chauncellour, or Lord keeper of the great Seale for the tyme beyng, shall, and may occupie, exercise, and enioye the same office of Custos rotulorum, by hym selfe, or by his sufficient deputie, or deputies, in as ample, and large maner, and fourme, as if the saied acte had neuer been had ne made, the before rehearsed acte, or anye thing theryn conteyned to the contrarye herof in anye wyse notwithstandyng.

Prouyded alway, and be it enacted by the aucthoritie aforesayed, that all such as now haue any of ye sayed offices of Custos rotulorum, by the kinges letters patentes, or commission, to thē, or any of them made, shall, & may enioy, haue, and exercise theyr sayed offices by vertue of the same letters patentes, or commission, by him selfe, or his sufficient, and hable deputie, instructed in the lawes of this realme, any thing in this presēt acte, had, or made to the contrary notwithstanding.

Prouyded also that it be enacted by the aucthoritie aforesayed, that the Archebishop of Yorke, the byshop of Durham, the byshop of Ely, and euery of theyr successours, the Chauncelour of the Duchie of Lancaster for the tyme beyng, and all, and euery person, and persons, corporations, and bodies corporated, to whom the kinges maiestie, or anye of hys noble progenitours by hys, or theyr letters patentes, or Acte of parlament, haue geuen, and graunted anye libertie and aucthoritie, or otherwyse haue aucthoritie by other lawfull meanes, or wayes, to ordeyne, make, & constitute, any of the sayed officers of Custos rotulorum within anye countie palantine, or other place, shall, and maye haue, and enioye the same libertie, & aucthoritie, according as they haue had, and enioied the same, any thing in this presēt act, had, or made, to the contrary notwithstanding.

div.head: ¶ The .ii. Chapitre. ¶ An Acte for the true making of woullen clothes.
div.p: FOrasmuche as by the sleighte, and subtile making of Clothes, and colours, within dyuers partes of thys realme, now of late practised, & vsed, not onely great infamies & slaundres hath growē to the same realme but also the kinges maiesties faithfull, and true subiettes haue susteyned great losse in the vse, and wearing of the same clothes, so sleightly, & subtily made. For remedye, and reformacion wherof: bee it ordeyned, & enacted by the kinges most excellent maiestie, with thassent of the Lordes spirituall, & temporall, and the cōmons in this present parlament assembled, and by the aucthoritie of the same, that euerye Clothter, and Clothmaker, shall from the feast of the annunciation of our Ladie next commyng, set hys Seale of Leade to his Cloth, declaring therby the iust lengthes therof to be tryed by the water. And that no persone shall from the sayed feaste streygne, or stretche any set clothes, or any other cloth, aboue one yarde and a di. in length, and a quarter of a yarde in breadth, vpon peyne to forfetct .xl. s. for euery defaut. And that no person, nor persones, shall frō the sayed feast, vpon peyne last before remembred, put to sale any cloth, which when it shalbe wet, shall shrinke more then .i. yarde &. di. in all the length, and a quarter of a yard in the breadth. And that narrow streites, and kerseyes, shall not from the saied feast be stretched, aboue a yarde in length, and di a {quam}. of a yarde in breadth, vpon the peyne for euerye default therin .xx. s. nor shall put to sale ane cloth, narrow, streyte, or kersey the pieces wherof being wet, shall shrinke more then after the same seuerall rates in the whole piece, vpon peyne to forfeycte for euerye suche offence .xx. s. And further, that no persone, or persones, occupyeng the feate of dyeng, shall dye, or alter into colours, or cause to be died, or altred into colours, any wollen clothes, as browne blewes, picukes, tawnies, or violettes, except the same wollen clothes be perfectly boyled, greyned or madered vpon the woade, and shot with good, and sufficient corke, or orchal after a due, substanciall, & sufficient maner of workemanshyp, according to thauncient workmanship in time past vsed, vpon peyne for euery default to forfeyt .xx. s. nor that any person shall from the sayed feast dye any woll to be cōuerted into cloth called russettes, mustres, marbles, grayes, royes, & such lyke colours, or to be conuerted, & made into hattes or cappes, onles the same woll be perfectlye woaded, boyled, and maddred according to the true, & auncient vsage, vpon the peine of forfeyture for the false dyeng of euery such cloth, or of asmuch wolle, as shall serue for the makyng of euery cloth contrary to the true meanyng therof .xl. s. Nor shall dye with brasell to thintent to make a false colour in cloth nor wolle hattes, nor cappes, vpon peyne for euery default to forfeyt .xx. s.

And that no person, or persones, shall after the sayed feast put any flockes, chalke, flowre, or sterche, or any other deceiuable thyng, vpō any set clothe, or vpon any other cloth, or clothes coloured, or vncoloured, vpon
〈1 page duplicate〉
〈1 page duplicate〉
peyne to forfeycte for euery suche offence .xl.s. And that no persone shall from the sayed feast, occupie any yron cardes, or pickardes in rowing of any set cloth, or any maner of wollen cloth, vpon peyne to forfeyt aswell the sayed yron cardes, or pickardes, as also the summe of .xx.s. for euery such offence. Nor that any persone shall from the saied feast sell any cloth by any lesse measure then after the true content therof, to be moten and measured by the yarde, adding to euery yarde, one inche of the rule, accordyng to the statute made in the .vi. yeare of the reygne of the most worthy prince of most famous memory kyng Henry the .viii. Father vnto our souereigne Lorde the kyng that nowe is, vpon peyne to forfeycte for euerye yarde of cloth so put to sale, by anye other lesse measure .vi.s. viii.d. And that no persone shall from the sayd feast, put to sale here with in the realme, eyther by retayle, or otherwise, any cloth beyng pressed to be occupied, and worne here within the realme of Englande, Wales, or Irelande, vpon peyne of forfeyture of the same cloth, or the value therof that haue been so pressed, and put to sale as is last before remembred.

And for the better executing of thys statute: be it enacted by thauctoritie aforesaied, that in euery toune, village, or Hamlet, being not corporate, where anye cloth shalbe made, or solde, the Iustice of peace of the same shyre where any such toune, vyllage, or hamlet is, or two of them at the least, and in euery citie, borough, or toune corporate, the head officer, or officers of euerye the same citie, borough, or toune corporate together with the wardens of the clothworkers, or two of them at the least, shall haue full power, and aucthoritie, by vertue of this acte, once euerye yere to conuent, and call before them by theyr precept, or otherwyse .ii. iiii. vi. viii. or more, as they shall thinke good by theyr discrecion, of the most honest, discrete, & indifferēt men of euery such citie, borough, toune, village, or hamlet, where any cloth shalbe made, or sold, & thē shall cōstitute, ordeyne, and appoynt to be ouerseers for one whole yere then next folowing within the citie, borough, toune, village, or hamlet, where the same ouerseers shalbe dwelling, charging them also vpon theyr othes, and as they doe tender thonor of the realme, and the cōmon wealth of the same, that they doe endeuour them selues for that yere, asmuch as in them shal lye to see that this statute be truely obserued, and kept within the limites of theyr charge, in euerye part therof. And that the same ouerseers, or .ii. of them, shall euery quarter of the saied yere at the least, or so oftē as nede shal require by their discrecions, by force herof, visite, and goe into euery clothiers, drapers, cloth workers, diers, and pressors houses, shoppes, & other places, where cloth, or died woll shalbe, & there to make due search & to view the clothes, and wolles, made, or dyed, or remaining to be sold and to serche and trye, aswell whether the sayed clothes, be drawen, or streigned, or falsly dyed, as also of all other the defaultes before specified, commytted, or doen, contrarye to the true meanyng of thys acte. And if vpon the serche, the clothes be founde drawen, or streyned, or the cloth, or
wolles falsly dyed, or coloured, or any other of the sayed faultes committed, or doen contrary to the true meanyng of thys statute: That then the saied seuerall forfeytures to encurre vpon the partie, or parties, whiche shall offende in the same, or in any of them: thone halfe of all whiche forfaitures to be vnto the king our Souereygne Lorde, hys heyres, or successours, and thother halfe to such of the sayed ouerseers, as doeth fynde the saied defautes, or causes of forfaitures, and that will sue for the same in any of the kynges courtes of recorde, or before the Iustices of peace, within any such citie, borough, or toune corporate, or before the Iustices of peace within any shyre where anye suche forfeitures shalbe had out of any citie or towne corporate, the same suite to be pursued by byll, plaint, action of debt, information, or otherwyse, and in whiche suite, no wager of lawe, essoine, or protection shalbe allowed for the defendaunt. And if the sayed ouerseers shalbe negligent, and will not sue for the same forfaitures, by the space of one halfe yere next after the cause of the same forfaitures committed, & doen, that then thone halfe of the same forfayture to be vnto our sayed Soueraygne Lorde the kyng, his heyres, or Successours, and the other halfe to hym whiche will sue for the same, as is aforesayed, within one other halfe yere next after such default be had by the saied ouerseers. And if any of the sayed persones so commaunded to appeare to be made ouerseers, as is aforesayed, & hauing no reasonable excuse, doe refuse to come, & to take vpō him, or them to be an ouerseer, as is aforesaied, that then euery such persone refusing, & hauing no reasonable excuse so to doe, to forfaicte for euerye suche refusing .xl.s. thone halfe therof to be to the kyng our sayed Souereygne, hys heyres, or successours, and the other halfe to the Iustices of peace, or other head officer, or Officers, by whose commaundement he was commaunded to appeare, or to be an ouerseer, and the same ouerseer so offending, to remain in the warde of the Sherife, vntyll suche tyme, as he had made payement of the sayed forfaicture, or otherwise put in sufficient bonde for the satisfaction of the same. And if the same ouerseers, or two of them at the leaste, doe not once euery quarter of the yeare, make due searche for the true executing of thys statute: that then euery of the sayed ouerseers, to forfaycte for euerye suche defaulte .x.li. thone halfe to be to the Kynges highnesse, hys heyres, or successours, and the other halfe to him that will sue for the same by byll, playnt, accion of debt, information, or otherwise. In whiche suite, no essoyne, or protection shalbe allowed for the defendaunt. And if the sayed ouerseers shalbe interrupted, and not suffred to entre into the saied houses, shoppes, or other places, where any such clothes, or wolles shalbe made, or died, or any other of ye sayd defaultes shal happen to be doen, or commytted, there to make searche for the better executyng of thys Statute, that then euery one that so shall make anye suche interruption, shal forfeycte .xx.l. the one half of whiche forfeicture to be to oure sayd Souereigne Lord the kyng, hys heires, or successours,
and thother halfe therof to be to the sayed ouerseers, to whome any such interruption shalbe made, and the same to be obteyned, and pursued for, in such maner, and fourme, as before in thys acte is expressed for the recouerie of other of the sayed forfeyctures.

Prouyded alwaies, & be it enacted by thauctoritie aforesayed, that it shall, & may be lefull to euery person, and persons, to put to sale any cloth or clothes, made, dyed, or prest, whiche before the sayed feast of the Annunciation of our Ladie shalbe made, dyed, or prest, at anye tyme within one yere, next after the sayed feast of the Annunciation of our Ladye, so as the Alnager, or his deputie, or other head officer in anye suche citie, Borough, Towne, Village, or hamlet, doe put some notorious marke to euery such cloth, wherby the same may be knowen to be made before the sayed feast of the Purification of our Lady next commyng.

Prouyded also, that no maner of person, shall take any aduauntage of any of the sayed forfeictures, by reason of thys Statute, onlesse the same persone doeth cōmence his suite, within one yere next after the sayed offences, and forfeictures committed.

And to thentent, that all suche clothes as shalbe made within thys Realme, or any other of the kynges dominions after the said feast shalbe the better knowen from the other clothes made before the same time: Be it therfore enacted by thaucthoritie afore saied, that euery Clothier shall before such time, as he shall putte his cloth to sale, being made after the sayed feast, cause euerye cloth to be marked with a lettre of E. crowned, wrought in the cloth, vpon peyne of forfeycture for euerye cloth so beyng solde, and not marked with the sayed lettre E. by anye such clothier .xx.s. the one halfe of whiche forfaycture to bee to our soueraygne Lorde the king, his heyres, or successours, and thother half to hym that will sue for the same in maner, and fourme before rehearsed.

div.head: ¶ The .iii. Chapter. ¶ An Acte concerning the improuementes of commons, and wast groundes.
div.p:
WHere in the parlament holden at Marton in the .xx. yere of the reygne of king Henrye the third, it is conteined that forbecause many great men of Englande which had enfeoffed Knyghtes, & other their free tenauntes of small tenements in theyr great manours dyd complayne that they myght not make theyr profits of ye residue of theyr manours, as of wast woddes and pastures, where the same feoffees had sufficient pasture, as muche as belōged vnto theyr tenemētes, it was prouided & graūted, that what soeuer persons so enfeoffed, brought assyse of nouel disseison, of theyr cōmon of pasture, & before the iustices it were recognised, that they had asmuch pasture as dyd suffise vnto theyr tenementes, and that they had free ingresse,
and egresse into, & from their tenemētes vnto theyr pasture, that then they should therwith be contented, and that they, vpon whome they had complayned, should depart quiete with that, that they myght make theyr profite of theyr landes, wastes, woddes, and pastures. And if it were sayed that they had not sufficient pasture, or sufficient ingresse, and egresse, asmuch as doth belong vnto theyr tenemētes, as is abouesaied, that then the trueth therof shoulde be enquired by Assyse: and if it were recognised by the Assyse, that theyr ingresse, & egresse were in any thyng letted by the same deforciatours, or that they had not sufficient pasture and sufficient ingresse, & egresse, as is aboue saied, that then they shoulde recouer theyr seison by viewe of the iurours, so that by the dyscrecion, and othe of them, the complaynantes should haue sufficient pasture, and sufficient ingresse, and egresse, in fourme afore sayed, & that the dysseisours shoulde be in amerciament of the kyng, and shoulde yelde damages, as they were wont to doe before the same prouision. And if it were recognised by the assise, that the complainauntes had sufficient pasture with free ingresse, and egresse, as is aboue mencioned, that then the other myght lawfully doe theyr profite of the residue, and shoulde goe quyte from the same assise, as in the sayed estatute more plainly appeareth.

And where also in the parlament holden at Westminster, after Easter, the .xiii. yere of the reygne of king Edward the fyrst, it was ordeined that where in the statute made at Marton, it was agreed, that lordes of wastes, woddes, and pastures, myght approue them selues of theyr wastes, woddes, and pastures, notwithstandyng the gaynesaying, and contradiction of theyr tenauntes, whyles the same tenauntes had sufficient pasture to theyr tenementes, with free ingresse, and egresse, into, & from the same. And for that no mencion was made betwene neighbour and neighbour, manye Lordes of wastes, woddes, and pastures, vnto that time were let by contradiction, or gaynsaying of neyghbours, hauyng sufficient pasture. And forasmuche as foreyn tenauntes haue no greater right of commoning in the wood, wast, or pasture of any Lorde then the propre tenantes of the same lorde, it was from thencefourth ordeyned, that the sayed Statute prouyded at Marton, betwene the lord and his tenauntes, should haue place from thenceforth betwene the Lordes of wastes, woddes, and pastures, and neighbours, sauing sufficient pasture to theyr men, and neyghbours, so that the Lordes of the same wast, wastes, woddes and pastures maye approue them selues of the residue, and that the same shoulde be obserued of them that claime pasture, as perteinyng to theyr tenauntes. But if anye manne clayme common of pasture by speciall feoffement or graunt, to a certeyne numbre of beastes, or otherwyse, then of common right he ought to haue it. Where couenaunt doeth abrogate the lawe, he shall haue suche recouerie, as he ought to haue by fourme of the graunt to him made. And that by occasion of a Windmyll, shepehouse, dairye, augmentation, or encrease of anye court necessarye, or curtilage, from thencefourth, no man should be
greued by assise of nouel disseison, of common of pasture. And for as much as it happeneth sometyme that some men hauyng right to approue to hym selfe, hath made, or leuied a diche, or a hedge, & other by night, or such other tyme, when they beleue theyr deede should not be knowen, dooe, or will cast downe the same diche, or hedge, and that it cannot bee knowen by veredite of assise, or iurie, who dyd cast down the same diche or hedge nor the men of the next towne wil endicte them that be gyltie of the same deedes, then the next towneshyp adioigning about the same shalbe destreigned to leuie, and make vp the same diche, or hedge, at theyr propre costes, and to yelde dammages, as in the sayed estatute emongest other thynges more playnly appereth.

And forasmuche as the aforesayed estatutes been thought beneficiall for the common wealth of thys realme of Englande. Be it enacted by the kyng our Souereygne Lorde, with the assent of the Lordes spirituall, and temporall, and the commons in thys present parlament assembled, and by the aucthoritie of the same, that all and euery the sayed Statutes, and all braunches, clauses, articles, sentences, matters, and poynctes conteyned, and specifyed in them, and euery of them, nowe not repealed, shall from hencefourth be good, and effectuall, and also stand, and be in their full strength, force, and effect.

And because that such persones as shall bryng assise of nouel disseison vpon the sayed estatutes, or vpon any of them, shall by force of the same estatute, recouer but onely single dammages, whiche is thought to bee a small recompence for the same. Therfore be it enacted by thaucthoritie aforesayed, that such person, and persones, as shall at anye tyme hereafter bring assise vpon any braunche, or article of the saied estatutes, or any of them, and haue iudgement to recouer, shall haue his, or their dammages trebled by the iudgement of the court, where such assise, & iudgement shalbe had.

And where in dyuers countreies of thys Realme, there hath bene builded vpon Commons, or wast groundes, certayne necessary houses with grounde, vnder the quantitie of three acres, and not aboue three acres, enclosed to, and with the same, and in some place there is enclosed a garden, orchard, or pond, out, of, or in such wastes, or groundes, which excede not the quantitie of two acres, or theraboutes, whiche doeth no hurt, and yet is much commoditie to the owner therof, and to others: be it therfore enacted by the aucthoritie aforesayed, that the sayed two former actes, nor any of them, nor any thing in thē conteyned, shall extende to any such house, ground, or other thing so enclosed, as is last herin before mencioned, ne shall cause any person or persones, to lose, or forfayte any peyne, damage or penaltie for the same.

Prouyded alwayes, and bee it enacted, that if anye suche house hath been hertofore buylded vpon anye suche wast grounde, as is aforesayed, and that there be aboue the numbre of three acres enclosed to the
same, that then the sayed house, and three acres parcell of the same enclosure, shall still remayne, stande, abyde, and continue in lyke, and the same fourme, and degree, as it nowe doeth, and that the ouerplus of the sayed three acres so enclosed, as is aforesaied, shall, and may be layed open by thowner, or owners of the same wastes, anye thyng in this acte, or in any of the sayed former actes, to the contrary in any wyse notwithstanding.

div.head: ¶ The .iiii. Chapitre. ¶ An Acte concernyng grauntes, and gyftes made by patentees out of letters patentes.
div.p:
WHere the ryght noble, and famouse king of full worthy memorie kyng Henry the .viii. father to our most dread, and nowe naturall Souereygne liege Lord, sithens the fowerth daye of Februarye in the .xxvii. yere of his late reygne, and also the kinges most excellent Maiestie, by theyr seuerall letters patentes haue geuen, graunted, bargained, solde, and exchaūged, to, and with dyuerse and sundry the subiectes of this realme, bodies politique, and corporate in fee simple, fee taile, for terme of lyfe, or yeres, diuers honours, castles, manours, landes, tenementes, and other hereditamentes, and offices: After, & since which grauntes, bargaines, sales, and exchaunges, diuerse of the saied patentees, theyr heires, successours, or assignes, haue bargained, solde, geuen, exchaūged, or dimised diuerse particuler partes, parcels, or portions of the saied honours, castles, manours, lādes, tenemētes, hereditamētes, & offices, or other thinges therunto appertaining, or belōging to other persone, or persones, bodies politique, or corporate, that is to saye, to some of thē in fee simple, to some other in fee taile, for terme of life, or yeres, or otherwise. And after the same patentees for cōsiderations them mouing, haue surrendred, or geuen vp theyr saied lettres patētes into the Chauncerie, or otherwise the same lettres patentes haue been forfaited by attaindre, lost, cancelled, embesiled, or by other waies or meanes haue come to the handes of the kinges maiestie hys late father. And therupon oft tymes the enrollemēt of the same hath been made voyde, and frustrate, sometime in part, and sometime in the whole, by reason wherof, suche persones, bodies politique, or corporate, as haue had interest or tytle, in, or to the same Castles, manours, or particuler portiones, or parcelles of the same so to them geuen, and graunted, haue been in tymes past, and in tyme to come are lyke to be dysherited, or in daunger of losse of theyr interest, in, or to the same, to theyr no litle hynderaunce, and peryl: For remedie wherof, be it ordeined, establyshed, and enacted by thaucthoritie of this present parlament
that all & euery person or persones, bodies politique, or corporate, which lawfullye shall, or maye clayme by force of any patent, or patentes made sithens the fowerth daye of Februarye, or hereafter to be made by the kynges maiestie, hys heyres or successours, kynges of thys realme, or by any of them, and all other that nowe haue, or hereafter shall happen to haue anye good or lawfull estate, ryght, tytle, rent, profeicte, interest, or possession, of, in, to, or out of any honours, manours, landes, tenemētes, hereditamentes, or offices, or of other thynges, to anye of the premysses, apperteynyng or belongyng, or to anye part, parcell, or membre of them, or anye of them, by, from, or vnder anye such patent, or patentes, or any of them, or by, from, or vnder the heyres, successours, or assignes of them, or anye of them, or by, from, or vnder the state of anye others, whiche had, haue, or hereafter shall haue the state, tytle, or interest, of anye suche patentee, or patentees, or by any other meanes vnder the date of suche letters patentes, shall, and maye at all tymes hereafter, in anye the kynges courtes, hys heyres, or successours, and els where, by vertue of thys present acte, make, and conueygh vnto them selfe tytle by waye of declaration, playnt, auowrie, tytle, barre, or otherwyse, aswell agaynst the kynges highnesse, his heyres, & successours, and euery of them, as agaynst anye other persone, or persones, vnto the sayed honours, castles, manours, landes, tenementes, offices, and other the premisses, or any part, or parcell of the same, vnto them, or any theyr predecessours, or auncestours, or others, whose estate they haue in the same, by, frō, or vnder the said patentes, or any of thē, or theyres, auncestours, or assygnes of anye of them, or otherwise, vnder the date of the sayed lettres patentes, comprised, & conteyned in any exemplification, or constat therof made, or to be made, by the shewing fourth of the saied exemplification, or constat of ye rolle, or of so much therof, as shall serue for the matter in variance, vnder the great seale of Englande. And the same exemplification, or constat of the saied enrollement so (as is aforesayed) pleaded, and shewed, shalbe of lyke, & the same force, and effect, to all entētes, & cōstructions in the lawe, as ye saied fyrst lettres patentes were, & should be of, if the same were, or should be pleaded, or shewed.

div.head: ¶ The .v. Chapitre. ¶ An Acte for the punishment of vnlawfull assemblies, and rysing of the kinges subiectes.
div.p:
FOrasmuche, as it is most necessary in a common wealth to prouyde that tranquillitie, and peace maye be continued in this realme, and that all thinges being cōtrary therunto, may by foresight be eschewed: therfore it is ordeyned, and enacted, by the king our souereigne Lorde, with the assent of the Lordes, and Communes, of thys presente Parlamente assembled, and by the aucthoritie of the same, that if
anye persones, to the numbre of .xii. or aboue, beyng assembled together at any tyme, after the .xii. daye of February next commyng, shall intende, goe about, practise, or put in vre, with force of armes, vnlawfully, and of theyr awne aucthoritie, to murdre, kill, slaye, take, or imprison, any of the Kynges most honourable priueye counsaile, or vnlawfullye to alter or chaunge anye lawes, made, or establyshed for Religion, by aucthoritie of Parlament, or any other lawes or estatutes of thys realme, or anye of them. The same number of .xii. or aboue, being commaūded or required, by the Shirife of the Shyre, or by any Iustice of peace of the same Shyre, or by the Maior, Shirifes, Iustices of peace, or Baylyfes, of any citie, borough, or towne corporate, where any such assemblie shalbe vnlawfullye had, or made, by Proclamacion in the kynges name, to retyre, & repayre to theyr awne houses, habitacions, or places from whēce they came, and they or any of them, notwithstanding suche Proclamacion, shall remayne, or make theyr abode, or continue together, by the space of an whole houre, after suche commaundement or request, made by Proclamacion, or after that shall willyngly, in forceable and ryotous maner attempt to doe, or putte in vre, anye the thynges aboue specifyed: That then aswell euery suche abode or continuyng together, as euerye suche acte or offence, that after suche Proclamacion, commaundement, or request had or made, shalbe attempted to be doen, practised, or put in vre by any persones, being of the numbre aforesaied, shalbe iudged high treason, in all and singuler those persons, that so shall make theyr abode, or continue together, or shall attempt or commyt any suche acte, and the offendours therin, theyr aydours, abbettours, and procurers, to be adiudged Traytours to the Kyng and the realme, and shall suffre execution of death, as in case of hygh treason.

And ferthermore, be it enacted, ordeyned, and establyshed, by thaucthoritie aforesayed, that if any persones, to the sayed numbre of .xii. or aboue, after the sayed .xii. daye of February, shall intende, goe about, practise, or put in vre, in maner and fourme aforesayed, to ouerthrowe, cutte, breake, cast downe, or dygge vp the pales, hedges, dytches, or other closure of anye Parkes, Parke, or other groundes, or grounde enclosed, or the bankes of any fyshe ponde or poole, or anye Conduictes for water, Cōduite headdes, or Conduite pipes, hauing course of water, to the intent that the same, or any of them, frō thencefurth should remayne open, not inclosed or voyde, or vnlawfully to haue cōmon, or waye in the saied Parkes, Parke, or other groundes, or grounde inclosed, or in anye of them, or to destroye the Dere, in any maner of Parkes or Parke, or any Warreins or Warrein of Conies, or any Douehouses, or anye fishe in any ponde or poole, or to pull or cut downe, any houses, barnes, mylles, or Bayes, or to burne anye stackes of corne or grayne, or to abate, defalke or diminyshe the rentes or yerelye value of any Manours, Landes, or tenementes, or the pryce of anye victuall, Corne, or Grayne, or
any other thing, vsuall for the sustenaunce of men: and beyng required or cōmaunded, by any Iustice of peace, or by the Shirife of the countie, or by the Maior, Bailife, or Bailifes, or other head officers of any head citie, or towne corporate, where such assemblie shalbe had, by proclamacion to be made in the kynges name, to retyre or retourne, in peaceable maner to theyr habitacions, places, and houses, from whēce they came, and they, or any of them, notwithstanding such Proclamacion, shall remayne or make theyr abode, or cōtinue together, by ye space of one whole houre, after such commaundement, or request made by proclamacion, or after that shall in forcible maner attempt to doe, or put in vre anye of the thinges last before mencioned: That then aswell euery such abode, or cōtinuing together, as euery such acte, that after such proclamacion, commaūdement, or request, had or made, shalbe doen, practised, or put in vre, by any persones, being aboue the numbre of .xii. shalbe adiudged felony, and the offendours therin to be adiudged felons, and shall suffre execution of death, as in case of felony, and euery of the same persones, to lose the benefite of his clergie, and Sanctuary.

And also it is ordeyned and enacted by the aucthoritie aboue sayed, that if anye persone or persones, after the sayed .xii. day of February, vnlawfully, and without aucthoritie, by ringyng of any bell, or belles, soūding of any Dromme, Trompet, Horne, or other instrument whatsoeuer, or by fyering of any Beacon, or by malicious speaking, or vtteryng of any wordes, or making any outcrye, or by setting vp, or casting of any bylles, byll, or wryting whatsoeuer, or by any other deede, or acte, shall rayse, or cause to be raysed, or assembled anye persones, to the numbre of twelue or aboue, to thintent that the same persones should doe, commit, and put in vre, anye of the actes, or thinges aboue mencioned, and that the persones, to the number of .xii. or aboue, so raysed and assembled, after request or commaundement, had or geuen, in fourme afore saied, shal make theyr abode, or continue together, as is aforesaied, or vnlawfullye perpetrate, doe, commit, or put in vre, any of the actes, or thynges aboue saied: that then all and singuler persones, by whose speaking, dede, acte, or any other the meanes aboue specifyed, any persones to the numbre of twelue or aboue, shalbe reysed or assembled for the doing, committing, or putting in vre, anye of the actes, or thinges aboue mencioned, shalbe adiudged for hys so speakyng, or doyng, a felon, and shall suffre execution of death, as in case of felonye, and shall lose hys benefite, and Sanctuary, and Clergie.

And ouer that, it is ordeyned and enacted by the aucthoritie aforesayed, that if any persones, to the numbre of .xl. and aboue, after the saied xii. daye of Februarye, shalbe assembled together, in forcible maner vnlawfully, and of their owne auctoritie, to thyntent to doe, exercyse, or put in vre, any of the thinges aboue mencioned, or to doe anye other trayterous, Felonious, or Rebellious acte, or actes, and so shall continue by
the space of two houres, that then euery persone, so beyng willingly assembled, in forcible maner & so continuing, by the space of two houres, shalbe adiudged a traytour to the kynge, and to the realme, and shall suffre execucion of death as in case of hygh treason.

And also, that if any wyfe or seruan̄t of any of the same persones, or any other persone whatsoeuer, shall willingly, and without compulsion bring, send, deliuer, or conueigh any money, harneis, artillery, weapon, meate, bread, drinke, or other victuall, to any person, or persones, so being assembled as is afore saied, during suche tyme, as he or they shall so be assembled, or bee together, as is afore saied: that then euery wyfe seruant, or other persone so bringyng, sendyng, deliuering, or conueyghing any money, harneys, artillery, weapon, meate, bread, drinke, or victuall, to the same persones, so beyng assembled together, in forcible maner, or to any of them, shalbe iudged a traytour to the kyng, and to the realme, and shall suffre execution of death, as in case of hygh treason.

And ferthermore it is ordeyned and enacted, by the auctoritie abouesayed, that euery persone, that at any tyme herafter shalbe attaynted, of or for, any of the treasons, or treason aboue mencioned, shall vpon hys sayed attayndour, forfeycte hys goodes, Cattals, interestes, for terme of lyfe, and of yeres, landes, tenementes, and other hereditamentes, in lyke maner and fourme, as anye persone ateaynted of Felonye, onelye should, or ought to forfeycte, by the common lawes of thys realme, and not otherwise: that is to say, the kyng to haue the yere, and day, & waste of suche Landes and Tenementes, wherof any persone so attaynted, shall at the tyme of the treason committed, or at any tyme after, haue an estate of fee symple, and also the gooddes and Cattals, reall and personall. And that the Lordes, of whom, the sayed landes, and tenementes, or any part therof shalbe holden, to haue and enioye the landes and tenementes, holden of hym or them for euer, in such the same maner and fourme, as in cases of attaindour of Felonie, at the common lawe. And that euery persone, that at any time hereafter shalbe attaynted, of anye of the Treasons aforesaied, shall forfeict the Landes and Tenementes, and other hereditamentes, wherof he shalbe seazed, of any state in taile, or for terme of lyfe or lyues, at the tyme of any such Treason commytted, or at any time after, duryng hys lyfe onely, and no lenger, onlesse the persone so attaynted, shalbe therof seazed in hys demeasne, as of fee, at the time of the sayed treason committed, or at any tyme after. And that after the deceasse of the same persone, so attaynted, all and singuler such persones and persone, as should haue had and enioyed such landes, tenementes, and other hereditamentes, as any persone, that at any tyme herafter shalbe attainted, of, or for, any treason aboue specified, shall fortune to be seazed, of anye estate in tayle, or for terme of lyfe, at the tyme of any suche Treason commytted, or at anye tyme after, shall after the death of the same persone, that so shall fortune to be atteinted, haue and
enioye the saied landes, tenementes, and other hereditamentes, in lyke maner and fourme, as though no suche Attayndour had been had, anye lawe or vsage, to the contrary in any wise notwithstanding.

And ferthermore, it is ordeyned and enacted by the aucthoritie aboue saied, that if anye persones, aboue the numbre of two, & vnder the numbre of .xii. being assembled together, at any time after the saied .xii. daie of Februarie, shall intende, goe about, practice, or putte in vre, with force of armes, vnlawefullie, and of their awne auctoritie, to murder, kill, or slaie, any of the kinges Maiesties Subiectes, or to ouerthrowe, cut, breake, caste doune, or digge vp the Pales, Hedges, Diches, Wall, or other closure of any Parkes, Parke or other grounde enclosed, or the banke of any fishe Ponde or Poole, to the intente that thesame, or anye of them, from thensfurth, shoulde remaine open not enclosed, or voyde, or to haue Common, or waie in thesame Parkes or Parke, or other groundes or grounde enclosed, or in any of them, or to destroie any maner of Parkes, or Parke, or Fyshe ponde or Poole, or any Warreyns or Warreyn of Conies, or any Douehouses, or to pull, or cutte doune any house, Barne, Myll, or to burne any stackes of corne or graine, or alter, defalke, or abate the rentes or yerely value of any Manours, Landes, or tenementes, of any the kynges subiectes, or the price of any victuall, corne, or grayne, or any other thyng vsuall for the sustenaunce or apparell of men, and beyng required, or commaunded by any Iustice of the Peace, or the shirife of the countie, or by any Mayor, Bailifes, or Bailyfe, or other head officer, of any citie, or toune corporate, where suche assemblie shalbe had, by Proclamacion, to be made in the kynges name to retyre, or retourne to theyr habitacions, places, or houses, & they so required by suche Proclamacion, shall not so dooe, but after that, shall in forcible maner, in fourme aforesaied, attempt to doe, or put in vre, anye of the thinges last aboue mēcioned: that then euery of thesame persones beyng aboue the numbre of two, and vnder the numbre of .xii. shall suffre imprisonmēt, of hys or their bodyes, by the space of one yere, without baile or mainprise, and shall make fine and raunsome, at the kinges will and pleasure. And also, that if any persone or persones, at anytime after the saied .xii. day of February, shalbe damnified or hurted, by the doing committing, or putting in vre, of any vnlawfull act or thyng aboue mēcioned: That then all and singular persones, so damnified or hurt, shall recouer & haue damages with the costes of theyr suite, susteined in that behalfe, trebled agaynst the offendours therin.

And for asmuche, as suche euyll dysposed persones, whiche of late tyme made Commocions and Rebellion, in certaine places, within this Realme, being but fewe in number, at such tyme, as they dyd begyn the same commocion, were not in short tyme, after the begynnyng therof, suppressed by strength, for that the kinges louing subiectes, for feare to incurre in daunger of the lawes of thys realme, durste not take vpon
them so to doe, a great numbre of euill dysposed persones, dyd come and ioygne themselues to the saied small nūbre, wherby thesame euil disposed persones, tooke vpon them such boldnesse, that they would not be reduced to obedience, without much bloudshedding, to the great daunger of the Kinges Maiesties persone, where, if the kinges louing subiectes durst haue taken vpon them, to haue suppressed them at the beginning, suche inconuenience and bloudshed shoulde not haue folowed: Therefore it is also ordeined and enacted, by the auctoritie aforesaied, that if any persones, aboue the numbre of twoo, that at any time, after thesaied xii. daie of Februarie, shalbe vnlawfullie, and of theyr awne aucthoritie, assembled together, to the entent with force of armes, to doe, practise, or put in vre, anye of the thinges aboue mencioned, that then it shalbe lawefull, to euery Iustice of Peace, and to euery Shirife, in any Coūtie, being within the kinges Dominions, and to euery Maiour, Bailife, and other head officer of any Citie, or Toune corporate, for the time he shalbe in Office, or any other persone or persones, hauing ye Kinges Commission, or Letters from his highnes, or his priuie counsaill, aswel to rayse and assemble the kinges louyng Subiectes, in maner of warre to bee arayed, in suche great numbre, as he or they then shall thynke meete or able, to the intent by vyolence and strength to suppresse, apprehende, and take the sayed persones, that so shalbe vnlawfully assembled. And that if the sayed persones, so vnlawfully assembled, after such commaundement or request by Proclamacion, or otherwise made, shall continue together, and not endeuour themselues, to retourne towardes theyr habitacions, houses or places, frō whence they come, in such short time, as they may conueniently: that then it shalbe lefull to euerye Iustice of peace, shirife, and also to euery Mayour, bailyfe, and other head Officer of any Citie, or Towne corporate, and to euery other persone, hauing aucthoritie, as is aforesaied, aftersuch commaundement, or request by Proclamacion made, and to suche persones, as shalbe assembled, with any Iustice of peace, or shirife, or with any Mayour, bailife, or other head officer, of any Citie, or Toune corporate, and with euery other persone, hauing aucthoritie, as is afore sayed, to suppresse, apprehende, and take those persones, so vnlawfullye assembled, whiche after such request made, shall continue together, & not endeuour themselues to retourne towardes theyr habitaciōs, or places frō whēce they came. And that if the saied persones, so vnlawfully assēbled together, or anye of them shall fortune to be killed, slaine, maimed, or hurt, in, or about the suppressing or taking of them: that then euery suche Iustice of Peace, shirife, Maiour, bailife, and other head officer, and euerye other persone hauyng aucthoritie as is aforesayed, and all and singular persones, by him or them assembled, shalbe free, dyscharged, and vnpunyshable, aswell against the kyng, as against all and euery other persone and persones, of, for, or concernyng the kylling, slaying, maiming, and hurting,
of any persone or persones, so vnlawfullye assembled, that shall fortune to be killed, slayne, maymed, or hurt, about, or by occasion of suppressing or taking of them.

And ferthermor, be it enacted, by aucthoritie aforesaied, that all and euery Copieholder, or Customarieholder, being artificer, husbandman or labourer, and being of the age of xviii. yeres, or more, and vnder the age of .lx. yeres, not sicke, impotent, lame, maimed, ne hauing any other iuste, or reasonable excuse, or cause to the contrarie, and being required by the Shirife, Iustice or Iustices of Peace, or other hauing aucthoritie by this Acte, or by Commission, or Letters, as is abouesaied, in that behalfe, (they declaring their saied aucthoritie,) or being required by the immediate lorde or lordes of whome such Copiholdes, or Customarieholdes then shalbe holden, to serue the kinges Maiestie, for any the causes aboue rehearsed, & refuse so to doe, shall onely during the life of suche persone or persones so refusing, forfeicte and lose, to his or their Lorde or Lordes, of whome such Copie or Customary holdes then shall be immediatlye holden, and shoulde be holden, duryng the lyfe of suche persone or persones so refusyng, in case he or they had not so refused, all theyr Copieholdes, and Customaryholdes. And that it shalbe lawfull to euery such Lorde or Lordes, theyr heyres or assignes, of whome such Copieholdes, or Customarieholdes shalbe immediately holden, and should haue been holden in case suche persone or persones had not so refused, by vertue of thys present acte, to entre and take into hys, or their handes and possession, all suche Copieholdes, and Customarieholdes so holden of them, or any of them immediatlye: and to reteyne the same duryng onely the lyfe of euery suche offendour or offendours, in suche maner and fourme, as he or they should haue had, the rentes or seruices of suche Copieholde, or customary holde, in case such persone or persones so refusing had not refused. And that all and euery Fermour beyng a yoman, husbandman, artificer, or labourer, and beyng of the age of .xviii. yeres or more, and vnder the age of .lx. yeres, not sicke, impotēt, lame, maymed, ne hauing any other iust or reasonable excuse, or cause to the contrary, & being required by the shirife, Iustice, or Iustices of the peace, or other hauing aucthoritie by thys acte, or by commyssion or lettres, as is afore saied, in this behalfe (they declaring their saied aucthoritie) or being required by their Landelord, or landelordes, for the tyme beyng, to whome the rentes of suche Fermes shalbe then rysing, comming, or growing, to serue the kynges Maiestie, for any the causes aboue rehearsed, and refuse so to doe, shall during onely the lyfe of suche Fermour or Fermours so refusing, forfeict and loose to such landelorde and landelordes, as should haue had the rentes of such Fermours, during the lyfe and liues of such persone or persones so refusyng, all their sayed Fermes. And that it shalbe lefull to euery such Landelorde and Landelordes, their heyres and assignes, to whome the Rentes of such
Fermes shoulde haue been due, during the lyfe of such persone, or persones so refusing, in case suche persone, or persones had not so refused, by vertue of this present acte, to enter and take into his or theyr handes or possession all suche Fermes, and to reteine the same, duryng onely the lyfe of euery such offendour or offendours. Prouyded alwaies, and be it enacted by thaucthoritie aforesaied, that after the death of euery suche Copieholder, Customary holder, or fermour, as so shall offend, and forfeict any of theyr saied Copieholdes, Customary holdes, or fermes, as is afore saied, that then all & euery such persone, and persones, as should or ought to haue had ye saied copieholdes, customary holdes, or fermes, after, or by the death of such copieholder, customaryholder, or fermour, in case such copieholder, customary holder, or fermour, had not so offended, ne forfeicted, shall and may haue the same copieholdes, customary holde, and Fermes, by entre, accion, admission, or otherwise, in like maner, fourme, and condition, and by suche wayes and meanes, as they & euery of them should, might, or ought to haue had, if no such forfeicture or offence had been had, doen, or committed.

And ferthermore it is ordeyned and enacted, by the aucthoritie afore saied, that if any persone or persones, after the sayed, xii. daye of February, by open worde or deede, shall procure, moue, or styrre any other persone or persones to aryse, or make anye Trayterous or Rebellious assemblie, to thentent to doe, exercise, or put in vre anye of the thynges aboue mēcioned: that then euery persone so procuring, mouyng, or stirring any other, shall therfore be demed, and adiudged a Felon, and suffre peynes of death, and forfeicte his goodes, cattals, Landes, and tenementes, as in cases of Felonie, and shall also leese the benefite of hys Clergie and Sanctuary.

And also be it ferther enacted, by the aucthoritie aforesaied, that if any persone or persones, which at any time after the same daye, shalbe spoken vnto, moued, or styrred, to make any commocion, insurrection, or vnlawfull assemblie, for anye of the intentes aboue mencioned, and doe not within .xxiiii. houres next after he, or they shalbe so spokē vnto, moued or styrred (onlesse he shall haue a good and reasonable cause of excuse) declare the same to one Iustice of peace, or shirife of the sayed coūtie, or to the Maior, Shirifes, Bailife, or Bailifes, or other head officer of any citie, or towne corporat, where such speaking, mocion, or styrring shalbe had, shall suffre imprisonmēt, vntill he shalbe dyscharged, by thre Iustices of peace, of the same shire, where the offence shalbe, wherof one of the saied Iustices shalbe of the Quorum.

And it is ordeined and enacted, by thaucthoritie abouesayed, that if anye persone or persones, beyng about the age of .xviii. yeres, and vnder thage of .lx. yeres, beyng able to serue, and not sicke, lame, or impotent, shalbe required by any Iustice of the peace, or anye shirife of anye Countie, where any such assemblie shalbe, or by any Maior, Bailife, or
other head officer, of any Citie, borough, or Toune corporat, or by anye other, by the commaundement of any suche Iustice of peace, Shirife, Mayor, bailife, or other head officer, to goe with him or thē, to suppresse the persones vnlawfullye assembled, in maner and fourme afore sayed, that then euery persone so beyng able and required, doe willingly and obstinately refuse so to doe, shall suffre imprisonment of hys bodye, for one yere without baile or mainprise, and make fine and raūsome, at the kinges will and pleasure.

Prouyded alwaies, and it is enacted, by the aucthoritie aboue saied, that if the king, shall by his lettres patentes make any Lieutenaunt, in any countie or counties of thys Realme, for the suppressing of any commocion, Rebellion, or vnlawfull assembly: that then aswell all Iustices of peace, of euery such countie, and the shirifes, and shirife of the same, as all Mayours, bailifes, and other head officers, and all inhabitaūtes and subiectes, of anye Countie, Citie, Borough, or Towne corporate, within euery such countie, shall vpon the declaracion of the sayed lettres Patentes, and request made, be bounde to geue attendaunce, vpon the same Lieutenaunte, to suppresse anye Commocion, Rebellion, or vnlawfull assemblie, onlesse he or they, beyng so required, haue any reasonable excuse, for hys not attendaunce, vpon peyne of imprisonment for one whole yere.

And be it ferther enacted, by the aucthoritie aforesayed, that the ordre and fourme of the Proclamacions, that shalbe made by the aucthoritie of this acte, shalbe as herafter foloweth, or with the lyke ordre, and woordes in effect, that is to saye, the Iustice or other persone aucthorised by this Acte, to make the saied Proclamacion, shall make or cause to be made an Oies, and after that, shall openly pronounce, or cause to be pronounced these woordes, or lyke in effecte. ¶ The Kyng our souereygne Lord, chargeth, and cōmaundeth all persones beyng assembled immediatly to dysperse them selues, and peaceablie to depart to theyr habitacions, or to theyr lawfull busines, vpon the peynes conteyned in the act, lately made against vnlawfull, and rebellious assemblies. And GOD saue the king.

Prouyded alwayes, and be it enacted by the aucthoritie afore saied, that if any persone or persones, doe, or shall molest, let, hynder, or hurte, any persone, or persones, that shall proclaime, or goe to proclayme, according to the Proclamacion and ordre made in the statute afore saied, wherby, such Proclamacion shall not be made: that then all and euery such persone and persones, so molesting, letting, hindering, or hurtyng, and all and euery suche persone and persones, offendour or offendours, to whome any suche Proclamacion or Proclamacions should, or ought to bee made, to the entente afore sayed, shall incurre, and bee in lyke daunger, & suffre like peyne or peines, and forfeictures, as aforesaied, in euery of theyr degrees, as though the Proclamacion had been made
any clause, article, or sentence, hertofore in thys acte included, made to the contrary, notwithstandyng. And be it enacted, by the aucthoritie aforesaied, that thys acte shalbe openly read, at euery quarter Sessions. SAVING to the Byshoppe of Duresme, and Byshoppe of Elie, and all other that haue chartre of the coūtie Palantine, and to their successours the yere, daye, and waste, in suche sort, as by the saied Chartre they had, or myght haue had the same, if thys Acte had neuer been had ne made: thys act, or any thing therin cōteined, to the cōtrary notwithstandyng. SAVING also, to all & euery persone and persones, and heires in tayll, bodies politique and corporat, their heires, successours, and executours and to euery of them, other then to suche persone and persones onely, as shalbe attainted, cōuicted, or outlawed for any of the foresayed offences of Felonie or treason, & their heires or the heyres of anye of them, claymyng by dyscent in fee simple, from them, or any of them, all such right, tytle, entre, interest, leases, possession, rentes, condicions, profites, commodities, and aduauntages, as they, or any of thē hath, or herafter shall haue, or of ryght ought to haue, in, or to any Honours, castles, manours landes, tenementes, woodes, rentes, reuersions, seruises, or hereditamentes, whatsoeuer, or in, or to, any part or parcel therof, to be forfeited, for any of the offences aforesaied, as if such attaindor or forfeycture, had neuer been had ne made, any thing in this Acte to the contrary, in anye wise notwithstanding. AND sauyng to all and euery bodye, & bodies politique & corporate, & their successours, their liberties and fraūchises, in suche maner and fourme, as if this acte had neuer been had ne made. This acte to continue to the ende of the next Parlament.

div.head: ¶ The .vi. Chapitre. ¶ An Acte concerning the repeale of a braunche, of an Acte of Parlament, made in the last Session for buying of Tanned Lether.
div.p:
WHere at youre Maiesties Parlament, holden at Westminster, vpon prorogacion, the .xiiii. daye of Marche, in thys present thyrde yere of your moste victorious reygne, emongest other thynges it was enacted, that no persone occupying the feate or misterie, of Coriar, Cordewainer, sadler, Cobler, Gyrler, Letherseller, Bottelmaker, or anye other Artificer, shoulde from, and after the feast of Michaelmasse then next following, sell, or cause to be solde, or put to sale, anye Backes or Hydes, of any Englishe kynde of tanned Lether vnwrought, or in such kynde, as he shoulde buye the same, (Calues skynnes onely excepted) vpon peyne of forfeyting for euery Hyde, Backe, or parcell of lether, that he or they should so sell, contrary to the sayed Statute .x. shyllynges. Sithen the making of which act, great and innumerable inconueniences hath, and hereafter is lyke to come therof. Fyrst, neyther gyrdler, cordwainer,
〈1 page duplicate〉
〈1 page duplicate〉
Sadler, Malemaker, bottelmaker, or any other artificer, vsing tanned lether in theyr art, is, or shalbe able, at anye time, at any instant, to serue the kinges Maiestie, his nobles, Lordes, & commons, either of bootes, shooes, Gyrdles, Saddles, Barehydes, Males, Cofers, Pottes, or other thynges made of leather, for that the most parte of thartificers aforesayed, been poore mē, not alwaies able to prouide store, of suche sortes of leather, as should serue theyr tourne, in makyng such thinges, as is before mencioned, but must of necessitie, prouyde such leather, one of thē of another, as euer hertofore they haue accustomed to doe, whiche now by force of the extremitie of the sayed act, they may not doe, which is vnto the great hurt and hynderaunce, aswell of the kynges maiestie, as of his nobles, lordes, and commons, for that they, and euery of them be drieuē of necessitie to buye their lether, of a few persones, which been only mere regratours of the saied lether, at great, high, and vnreasonable prices, to the great hurte of the common wealth, whereby the sayed artificers been not able, to aforde the saied wares made thereof, so good chepe, as they haue doen heretofore. And also, by reason of the foresayed restreynt or bondage, of the foresaied artificers, from buying and selling of lether: there is no mā sith that tyme, willing to set, or put hys or their chyldren to be prentise with anye of the foresayed artificers: for that not onely they, and euery of them, been brought in such bondage, by reason of the sayed acte, but also by the meanes wherof, are neuer lyke to grow to any necessary substaunce, neither by thexercise of theyr sayed handye craftes, to susteine the necessities of theyr olde age withal: and not onely that, but also in all cities, boroughes, corporate townes therby they lose benefite and commoditie, of theyr Chartre and Fredome. For reformacion wherof, be it enacted, by thaucthoritie of this present Parlament, that it shalbe lawfull from hencefurth, to, and for euery of the sayed artificers, or handie craftes men, expressed or named in the foresayed acte to buye and sell, all maner of tāned lether, corried, or not corried, so that such shalbe conuerted, by such buier, or buiers, vnto any kynd of wares or other thynges made of tanned leather, within thys realme of Englande, or other the kinges dominions, any wordes, penalties, or forfeictures, comprysed or specified, in the aboue remembred acte, to the contrary herof in any wise notwithstanding.
Prouyded alwaies, and be it enacted, by the aucthoritie aforesaied, that thys present acte, shall endure but onely vnto the ende of the nexte Parlament.

div.head: ¶ The .vii. Chapitre. ¶ An Acte for the repeale of a Statute, made in the xxv. yere of the reygne of King Henry theyght touching the takyng of Wildfoule, at certeyne times of the yere.
div.p: WHere in the .xxv. yere of the reygne of your Maiesties father, of most famous memorye, Kyng Henrye theyght, an acte was made, conteinyng two braunches, wherof, the one was against ye taking of wyldfoule, betwene the last day of Maye, and the last day of August, with any nettes, or engins, vpon a peyne limited therupon, as in the sayed Statute, more largely doeth appeare: Forasmuche as the occasion of the sayed braunches, appeareth sithen to haue risen, but vpon a priuate case, and that no maner of common commoditie is sithen perceiued to be growen of the same, being notably, by daily experience founde, and knowen that there is at thys present, lesse plentie of foule, brought vnto the markettes, then was before the making of the sayed Acte, whiche is taken to come of the punishement of GOD, whose benefite was therby taken awaye from the poore people, that were wont to liue by theyr skill, in taking of the sayed foule, wherby, they were wont at that tyme to sustaine them selues, with their poore housholdes, to ye great sauyng of other kyndes of Victuall, of the whiche ayde they are nowe destitute, to their great and extreme impouerishyng: Humblye besechen your grace, your Maiesties true and faythfull subiectes, especiallye suche, as haue their places of habitacion, nigh vnto the Fennes, that all that braunche of the sayed Acte, made in the sayed .xxv. yere of your graces sayed Father of most noble memorye touching the takyng of Wyldfoule, in maner as is abouesayed, may be from hencefourth by your Maiestie, the Lordes Spirituall and Temporall, and the Commons in thys present Parlament assembled, and by the aucthoritie of the same, repealed, and vtterlye voyde, and of none effect, with all and euery article, sentence, matter, peynes, and forfeictures, conteyned, or otherwyse mencioned in the sayed braunche, as if the same Acte had neuer been had, ne made.

Prouyded, and be it enacted, by the aucthoritie abouesayed, that one other braunche, conteined in the sayed Acte, concernyng suche persones as shall presume by daye, or night willinglye to withdrawe, purloyne, take, distroye, or conueyghe, any maner of Egges, of any kinde of wildfoule, from, or in any Nest, place or places, where they shall chaunce to be layed, by any kynde of Wildfoule, with euery article, sentence, matter, peynes, forfeictures, and prouisions, conteyned, or mencioned in thys sayed last braunche, shall stande in full strength, and effect, to all purposes, intentes, and constructions, as if thys present acte had neuer been had nor made.

div.head: ¶ The .viii. Chapiter. ¶ An Acte for the continuance of the Statute of Sewers.
div.p: WHerein the Parlament holden at Westmynster, by Prorogacion the .xv. daye of Ianuarye, in the .xxiii. yere of the most victorious reygne of our late Souereigne Lorde Kyng Henry theyght, emong other thynges, one generall Acte, concernyng Commissions of Sewers, to be directed into all partes, within this Realme, was enacted and made to continue and endure for twentie yeres, then next following, as by the same act more at large it doeth and maye appeare. And forasmuch as the same Acte is thought good and beneficiall for the common wealth of this realme: Be it therfore enacted and ordeyned, by the king our Souereygne Lorde, with the assent of the Lordes Spirituall and temporall, and the commons in thys present Parlament assembled, and by the aucthoritie of the same, that the sayed Acte, and all clauses, articles, and prouisions, in the same conteyned, shall continue & endure in theyr force and strength, and to be obserued and kept for euer, in such maner and fourme, as shall and maye stande with the sequele & addicions, herafter mencioned.

And be it ferther enacted and established by the auctoritie aforesaied, that all skottes, lottes, and summes of money hereafter to be rated and taxed, by vertue of such commission of Sewers, vpon any of the landes tenementes, or hereditamentes, of our Soueraygne Lorde the kyng, hys heyres or successours, for any maner of thing or thinges, concerning the articles of the sayed commission of Sewers, shalbe gathered and leuied, by distresse or otherwyse, in like maner and fourme, as shall or may be doen in the landes, tenementes, & hereditamentes, of anye other persone or persones: and that all bylles of acquitaūce, signed with the hand or handes of such collectour or receiuour, as shall haue the collectiō therof by the appoyntment of the sayed cōmyssioners, or .vi. of them, shalbe aswell a sufficient dyscharge, to the tenauntes, fermours, & occupyers of the same groūdes, so to be charged for the sayed summe, wherwith theyr groundes shalbe so charged, as also a sufficiēt warrant to all and euery the receiuours, auditours, & other whatsoeuer officer or officers, of our sayed souereygne lorde the kyng, his heyres, & successours, for the allowaunce to suche Tenaunt, Fermour, or Occupyer for the same, addyng moreouer vnto this acte, by aucthoritie of thys present parlament, that suche, and lyke fees, and none other, nor more, shalbe at any tyme payed or demaunded, for any Commission or Commyssions, or writtes of dedimus potestatem, herafter to be sued out, or obteyned vnder the Seale of the Duchie, but onely such and lyke fees as been mencioned in the sayed former Acte, to be payed in the Chauncerie, for Commissions and writes of dedimus potestatem, to be obteyned from the same court of Chauncerie, adding moreouer therunto by thaunctoritie aboue saied, that euery cōmission, and cōmissions, herafter to be awarded for Sewers, shall continue
and endure for terme of .v. yeres, next after the teste of suche commission oneles the same commission and commissions, shalbe otherwise discharged, within the same by supersedeas, any thing or thinges mēcioned, or cōteined in the saied former acte, contrarie to the addicions before mencioned, or any of them, in any wise notwithstanding.

div.head: The .ix. Chapiter. ¶ An acte for buiyng of rawe hides and Calues skinnes.
div.p: FOrasmuche as lether is growen to an vnreasonable price, whereby the kinges Subiectes are not able at this daie to prouide them selfes, suche necessaries thereof made, as shoes, and botes, and suche like, at any reasonable price, as they heretofore haue doen, to the vtter empouerishement of diuers the Kynges louing and obedient subiectes: whiche said vnreasonable prices of lether doeth onely growe and rise, by reason of the vnsaciable desire of diuers & sundrie persones being no tāners, whiche daylie in euery market, and other place buie & regrate grene hides, in the heere and out of the heere to their handes, to the intent to sell the same to their awne lucre and gaine: Be it therefore enacted, by the king our Souereigne Lorde, the lordes spiritual and tēporal, and the commōs in this present Parlament assembled, and by thauctoritie of thesame, that no persone or persones within this realme, shal from, and after the feast of the Annunciation of our ladie next comming, buie, or cause to be bought any Calue skinnes or hides in the heere, or out of the heere, to the intent to sell againe the same vntanned, excepte onely suche persone and persones, as will tanne or tawe the same, vpon peine to forfeict for euery skinne or hide so bought, to thintent to sell againe, as aforesaied vi. s̄. viii. d. The one halfe of whiche forfeicture to be vnto our Souereigne Lorde the King: The other halfe to him or them that will sue for thesame, in any of the Kynges Courtes, by Byll, plaint, or other lawful processe, wherein no protection or wager of Lawe, nor yet any Essoine to the partie defendaunt shalbe allowed, or admitted.

div.head: The .x. Chapiter. An acte for the abolishing and putting awaie of diuers bookes, and Images.
div.p:
WHere the Kīges most excellent Maiestie hath of late set fourth & established by aucthoritie of Parlament, an vniforme, quiet, & godlie ordre of common and opē praier, in a boke ītitled The boke of common praier, and administraciō of the Sacramētes, and other rites and Ceremonies after the churche of England to be vsed & obserued in the saied churche
of Englāde, agreable to thordre of the primatiue churche, muche more comfortable vnto his louing subiectes, then other diuersitie of Seruice as heretofore of long time hath been vsed, being in the saied boke ordeined nothing to bee read, but the very pure worde of God, or whiche is euidentlie grounded vpon the same, & in the other, thinges corrupte vntrue, vaine, & supersticious, and as it were a preparatiō to supersticion, whiche for that they be not called in, but permitted to remaine vndefaced, dooe not onely geue occasion to suche peruerse persones, as doo impugne the ordre and godly meaning of the kinges saied boke of cōmō praier, to cōtinue in their olde accustomed supersticious seruice, but also minister greate occasion to diuersitie of opinions, Rites, Ceremonies and Seruices: Bee it therefore enacted, by the kinge our Souuereine Lorde, the lordes Spiritual, and Temporall, & the Commons in this present Parlament assembled, that all Bookes called Antiphoners, Missales, Grailes, Processionalles, Manuelles Legēdes, Pies, Portuasses, Primers, in Latine or Englishe, Couchers, Iournalles, Ordinalies, or other Bookes or writinges, whatsoeuer heretofore vsed for Seruice of ye Churche, writen or Printed in the Englishe or Latine toungue, other then suche as are or shalbe set furth by the kinges Maiestie, shalbe by auctoritie of this present acte, clearlie and vtterlie abolished, extinguished, and forbidden for euer to bee vsed, or kepte in this Realme, or elswhere within any the kinges dominions.

And be it further enacted, by the aucthoritie aforesaied, that yf any persone or persones, of what estate, degre, or condicion soeuer he, she or they be, bodies politique or corporate, that now haue, or hereafter shall haue in his, her or their custodie, any the bookes or writings of the sortes aforesaied, or any Images of Stone, Timbre, Alebaster, or earthe, Grauen, Carued, or Painted, whiche heretofore haue been taken out of any Churche or Chappell, or yet stande in any Churche or Chappell, and dooe not, before the last daie of Iune next ensuyng, deface and destroie, or cause to be defaced and destroied, the same Images, and euery of them, and deliuer or cause to be delyuered, all and euery thesame bookes to the Maiour, Baylife, Constable, or Churchewardens of the Toune, where suche Bookes then shal bee, to bee by theim deliuered ouer openlye within three Monethes nexte folowing, after thesaied deliuerie, to the Archebishoppe, Bishoppe, Chauncellour, or Comissarie of the same Dioceces, to the intent thesayed Archebishoppe, Bisshoppe, Chauncellour, or Commissarie, and euery of them cause theim im̄ediatelie, either to be openlie brente, or other wayes defaced and destroyed, shal for euerye suche Booke or Bookes willinglie reteined in his, her or their handes or custodie, within this Realme, or els where within any the kinges Dominions, and not deliuered, as is aforesaied, after the saied last daie of Iune, & be thereof lawefullie conuicte, forfeict and loose to the king our Souereigne lorde, for the first offence, tenne
shillinges. and for the seconde offence shal forfeict and lose being thereof lawefullie conuict, foure poundes. And for the thirde offence, shal suffre imprisonment at the kinges will,

And bee it further enacted by the aucthoritie aforesaied, that yf anye maiors, Bailifes, constables, or churchewardens, dooe not within thre monethes after the receypte of thesame Bookes, delyuer or cause to bee deliuered, suche bookes so by them receiued, to the Archebishoppe, Bisshoppe, Chauncellour, or Commissarie of theire dioces: And if the saied Archebishoppe, Bishoppes, Chauncellour, or Commissaries, dooe not with in fourtie daies after the receipt of suche bookes, burne, deface and destroie, or cause to be burned, defaced or destroied thesame bookes, & euery of theme, that then thei and euery of them so offending, shall loose and forfeict to our Souereigne Lorde the king, being therefore lawefullie conuict, fourtie poundes: The one halfe of al suche forfeictures, shalbe to any of the kinges Subiectes, that will sue for thesame, in any of the kinges Courtes of Recorde, by Bill, plaint. Accion of debte or informacion, in whiche accion no Essoine, protection, wager of lawe or other delaie shalbe allowed.

And for better execution of the same acte, beeit enacted by the aucthoritie afore saied, that aswell Iustices of Assise in their circuites, as Iustices of peace, within the limites of their Commission in the general sessions, shal haue ful power and aucthoritie, to enquire of the offences aforesaied, and to heare and determine the same in suche fourme as theie may dooe in other suche like cases.
