Prouided alwaies, that this Acte or any thynge therin conteined, shal not extende to any Image or picture, set or granē vpon any tombe in any Churche, Chappel, or Churchyarde, onely for a monumēt of any King, Prince, Nobleman, or other dead persone, whiche hath not been commonlie reputed and taken for a saincte, but that all suche pictures, and Images maie stande and continue in like maner and fourme, as if this acte hade neuer ben had nor made, any thing in this act to the contrarie in any wise notwithstanding.

Prouided alwaie and be it enacted, by aucthoritie aforesaied, that any persone or persones maie vse, kepe, haue and retaine any Primers in the Englishe or latine toungue, set fourthe by the late Kinge of famous memorie Kinge Henrie the eight, so that the sentences of inuocacion or praier to Sainctes, in the same Primers, be blotted or clearlie put out of the same, any thing in this Acte to the contrarie notwithstanding.

div.head: ¶ The .xi. Chapiter. An Acte that the kinges Maiestie maie nominate and. appoincte .xxxii, persones, to peruse and make Ecclesiasticall lawes.
div.p: AL bee it the kynges moste excellent Maiestie gouernour and ruler vnder GOd of this Realme, ought moste iustlie to haue the gouernement of his subietes and the determinacion of their causes, aswell ecclesiasticall as temporall, yet the same, as cōcerning Ecclesiasticall causes hauing not of long time been put in vre nor exercysed, by the reason of the vsurped authortie of ye Bishoppe of Rome, be not perfeictlie vnderstande nor knowen of his subiectes, and therfore of necessitie, aswel for the abolishing and putting to vtter obliuion the saiede vsurped aucthoritie, as for the necessarie administracion of iustice, to his louing subiectes: It maie please his highnesse, that it maie be enacted by his most gracious assent with the assent of the Lordes Spirituall and Temporall, and the Commons of this present Parlamente assembled, and by thaucthoritie of the same, that the kinhes Maiestie shal from hensforth during thre yeares, haue full power, aucthoritie, and libertie, to nominate and assigne by the aduise of his highnesse counsail sixtene persons of the clergye, wherof foure to be bishoppes, and sixtine persones of the Temporalitie, wherof foure to be learned in the common lawes of thys Realme, to peruse and examine the Ecclesiasticall lawes of longe time here vsed. And to gather, ordre, and compile suche lawes Ecclesiastical as shalbe thought to his Maiestie, his saied Counsail, and them or the more parte of them, conuenient to be vsed, practised and set furth with in this his Realme, and other his dominions, in all Spirituall or Ecclesiasticall Courtes and conuencions. And if after suche nominacion any of the persones so to be nominated happē to die, that then his highnesse by the aduise of his said Counsaill, during the saied three yeres, shall haue full power and aucthoritie, from time to time to nominate and assigne other in their places to supplie thesaied numbre of two and thirtie persones. And that thesaied twoo and thirtie persones so nominate, as is aforesaied. at all times from time to time, during the sayede three yeres, shal hauefull power and aucthoritie to assemble them selfes by his highnesse commaundement, for the perfeict colleccion, compiling and ordering of thesaied lawes. And be it also enacted by the aucthoritie aforesaied, that suche lawes Ecclesiasticall so compiled, gathered and ordered by thesaied twoo and thirtie persones, or the more numbre of them, and sette furth, published, and declared by the Kinges Maiesties Proclemacion, with thesaied aduise vnder his highnesse great Seale shal by vertue of this present acte be onely taken, reputed, practised, and put in vre for the kinges Ecclesiastecall lawes of this Realme and no other, any lawe Statute, vsage or prescripcion, to the contrarye thereof notwithstanding.

Prouided alwaies, and it is ordeyned and enacted by the aucthoritie aforesayed, that no maner of persone or persones shall at anye time
hereafter incurre, or bee in any contempt, peine, forfeicture or losse, or in daunger of any accion, or suite of premunire, by meane or occasiō of executing, or putting in exercise of any Lawes or matter, whiche shalbe deuised by the saied twoo and thirtie, or the more parte of them, and set furth by Proclamacion vnder the great Seale of Englande, or for holding of any maner of Plee, or making of any Processe, touching or concerning any suche Lawes or matter, any Estatute, lawe or Custome to the contrary in any wise notwithstanding.

Prouided also and be it enacted by the aucthoritie abouesaied, that all and euery Ecclesiasticall Iudge and ministre, that shal execute any thing by vertue of any suche lawes so to be set furth, as is abouesaied, shall from time to time obeie the kinges write and writes of prohibicion of attachement, vppon prohibicion and Indicauit, and not to procede contrarye to the tenour of suche write or writes, in suche and the same manour, fourme, and condiciō as thei haue, or ought to haue doen before the making of this acte, any thing in this acte to the contrarie in any wise notwitstanding.

Prouided alwaies and be it enacted, by ye aucthoritie afore sayed, that this acte or any thing therin conteined shall not extende, or be interpretated, to geue any aucthoritie to the sayd twoo and thirtie persones, or to the more numbre of them, or to the Kinges highnesse, for to compile, stablishe, publishe or set furth any Ecclesiasticall lawe repugnaunt, or contrarie to any commō lawe or Statute of this realme, any thing in this acte to the contrarie not withstanding.

div.head: ¶ The .xii. Chapiter. ¶ An acte for the ordering of Ecclesiasticall Ministers.
div.p:
FOrasmuche as concorde and vnitie to bee had within the Kinges Maiesties Dominions, it is requisite to haue one vniforme fashion and maner, for making and consecrating of Bishoppes, Priestes, Deacons, or Ministers of the Churche: Bee it therefore enacted by the Kynges highnesse, with the assent of the Lordes Spirituall and Temporall, and the Commons in this present Parlament assembled, and by the aucthoritie of the same, that suche forme and maner of making, & consecrating of Archebishoppes, Bishoppes, Priestes, Deacons, and other Ministers of the churche, as by sixe Prelates, and sixe other men of this Realme learned in goddes lawe, by the kinges Maiestie to be appoincted and assigned or by the moste numbre of them shalbe deuised for that purpose, and set furth vnder the greate Seale of Englande, before the first daie of April nexte comming, shal by vertue of this present Acte, bee lawefullie exercised and vsed, and none other: any Estatute, Lawe or vsage to the
contrarie, in any wyse notwithstanding.

div.head: ¶ The .xiii. Chapiter. An acte for the restitucion in bloude, of Sir William Sharington Knight.
div.p:
WHere sir William Sharington knight, aswell by the Course of the Common Lawe of this Realme of Englande, as by acte of Parlament, was latelie attainted of high Treason, and other offences, by reason whereof he is depriued, and dishabled in bloude and name to demaunde, aske, haue, and enioie suche Manours, Landes, Tenementes, and Hereditamentes, as shoulde or might come, descende, remaine, or reuert to him from any his lineall or collaterall auncestour or auncestours, to whom he should or might be heire in bloude. And where our Souereigne Lorde the Kinge, that nowe is, of his abundaunt clemencie, pitie, charite, especiall grace and mere mocion and by thaduise of his honorable counsaile, by his graces letters Patentes vnder his greate Seale of Englande, bearing date at Westminster the fifth daie of Nouembre, in the thirde yere of his reigne: hathe perdoned, remitted and released, vnto the saied sir William Sharyngton by the name of William Sharington late of London knight, otherwise called William Sharinton of London knight, otherwise called William Sharinton knight, otherwise called William Sharinton of Laicoke in the countie of Wilteshire knight, or by what other name, or surname, or addicion of name, or surname, he were knowen or called, all highe treasons and offences committed and doen by him, before the saied fifth daie of Nouembre as by thesame letters Patentes of perdon more plainelie appeareth. Our saied Souereigne Lorde the king at ye humble peticiō and sute of thesaied Sir William Sharington, is pleased, and contented, that it bee enacted, and established by his highnesse, with the assent of the Lordes Spirituall and Temporall, and the commons in this present Parlament assembled, and by thaucthoritie of thesame: that thesaied Sir William Sharington shalbe clearlie pardoned, acquited, released, and discharged of al and singular Treasons, and other offences mencioned, or expressed in the saied attaindour, or Attaindours, or Acte of Parlamente, or any of them, or whereof thesame Sir William was attainted, or conuicted before thesaied fifth daie of Nouembre, in thesaied thirde yeare of the reigne of our Souereigne Lorde the king that now is, and of all Iudgements, emprisonmentes, peines of death, and other peines, and penalties, whiche by reason thereof Sir William Sharington shoulde or myght in any
wise incurre, haue, suffre, or susteine. And that thesame Sir William Sharington, and his heires frō hensfurth maie and shal by auctoritie of this present Acte, bee restored and enhabled in bloude, and name to sue and be sued, impleade, and bee impleded, and to demaunde, aske, haue, and enioie all and singuler suche Manours, Landes, Tenementes, and hereditamentes, wyth theyr appurtenaunces whatsoeuer remaine, which at any time hereafter shall descende, come, or reuerte from any lineall or collaterall Auncestour, or Auncestours of the saied Sir william Sharington, as heire or heires to thesame Auncestour, or aūcestours, in suche maner, and fourme, as if thesaied Sir william Sharington had neuer been attainted. And that thesaied sir william Sharington, and al and singular the children and issues of the bodie of thesaied sir william Sharington, and all and euery other persone, and persones being of thole bloude to thesaied sir William Sharington, maie, and by aucthoritie of this present Acte shalbe from hensfurth restored, and enhabled in bloude and name, to demaunde, aske haue, and enioie, all and singuler suche Manours, Landes, Tenemētes, and hereditamentes, with their appurtenaunces whatsoeuer thei bee, whiche at any time hereafter shall descēde, Reuert, Remayne, come or growe to thesaied sir William Sharington, or his heires by discēt, Purchase, Gift, or otherwise, in suche, thesame, and like maner, fourme, and condicion to al ententes, constructions, and purposes, as if thesaied sir William Sharington hadde neuer been attainted. And that thesame sir William Sharington his Executours and administratours shall and maie in his or their awne name and names, sue, Aske, and demaunde, all suche Debtes, Couenauntes, and other thinges, to the saied sir william Sharington Growen, dewe hadde, or made, by, or vpon any writing, specialtie, or recorde, at any time before thesaied Attaindour or attaindours, which the Kinges Highnesse hath or shall by his Letters Patentes, or otherwise geue, Graunt, Appoint, or Assigne, to thesaied sir William Sharington, and the Moneie and other profeicte thereof comming, to Conuerte, haue, and retaine to the vse of the saied Sir William Sharington, his executours, or administratours, in suche thesame, and in like maner, fourme, and condicion, to all intentes, construccions, and purposes, as if thesaied Sir William Sharingtō shoulde or might haue doen, if he had neuer been attainted.

And be it ferther enacted by the auctoritie abouesaied, that ye saied sir William Sharington shal haue & enioie al suche fredomes, liberties, fraunchises, and priuileges within the Citie of Lōdon, and elswhere, aswell within the realme of England, as without, as he had, and enioied before thesaied attaindour or attaindours, in suche sorte, fourme and condicion as he hadde and enioied, or of right ought or might haue hadde, or enioied thesame, if thesaied Attaindour or Attaindours,
or any of them had not been had nor made, any forfeicture, iugement, Lawe, Statute, vsage, Custome, priuilege, or other thinges to ye contrarie not withstanding.

div.head: ¶ The .xiiii. Chapiter. ¶ An act for the restitucion in bloude of Marie Seimour, daughter to Sir Thomas Seimour knight, Lorde Seimour of Sudleie, late Admirall of Englande.
div.p:
IN most humble wise sheweth vnto your highnesse, your faithful subiect Marie Seimour daughter of sir Thomas Seimour knight, late lorde Seimour of Sudleie, & late highe Admirall of Englande, begottē of the bodie of quene Katherine late quene of Englande and late wife to the saied Thomas lorde Seimour, and before that, wife to your moste noble father of most famous memorie king Hērie theight That where as thesaied Thomas lord Seimour by auctoritie of your highnesse court of Parlamēt, holden at westminster, in the seconde yere of your most noble reigne, was iustelie attainted of high treason, & by reasō thereof your saied subiecte standeth, and is a persone in her bloud and Image corrupted: It maie please your highnesse of your most noble & aboundaunt grace, that it maie be at the hūble peticion of your saied subiecte ordeined, established and enacted by your highnesse, with thasser of the lordes spirituall and temporal, and of the cōmons in this present Parlamente assembled, and by aucthoritie of thesame, that your saied subiecte, and her heires maie bee and shalbe, by aucthoritie of this act, restored and enhabled onely in bloude, as daughter & heire & heires to thesaied Thomas lorde Seimour. And that your saied subiecte and her heires from hensfurth maie and shalbe enhabled to demaunde, aske, haue, holde, and enioie, al & euery suche honors, castels, manours, lordshippes, hūdredes, franchises, liberties, priuileges, aduousōs nominacions, presentacions, knightes fees, landes, tenemētes, rentes, reuersions, seruices, remainders, porcions, annuities, pencions, rightes, & all maner of hereditamēts, with their appurtenances, which at any tyme here after shal come, remaine, discēde or reuert from any collateral auncestour of your saied subiect, other then suche castels, manours, landes, tenementes, rentes, reuersions, seruices, remainders, porcions, annuities, pencions, rightes, and al maner of hereditaments with theire appurtenances, whiche were of the saied Thomas lorde Seimour her father in possession, reuercion, remainder, or otherwise, the daie of the attaindor of the saied Thomas lorde Seimour, or at any time after the treason by him cōmitted or doen: And other then suche honours, castels, manours, lādes, tenementes, and other hereditamentes as your highnesse was, or is intitled to haue, or might, or ought to haue vpon any
Office found or to be founde, by force of the said Attaindour in suche the same and like maner, fourme, and condicion, to al intētes, construccions and purposes, as if the saied Thomas Lorde Seimour father to your saied subiect had neuer been attainted, and as though no suche attaindour of the saied Thomas Lorde Semour had euer been hadde or made. And that your saied Subiecte and her heires maie hereafter vse and haue any Action or suite, and make her pedegree and conueiaunce in bloude as heire, aswell to and from her saied father, as also to any other persone, or persones, in like maner, fourme, and degree to all intentes, construccions, and purposes, as if the saide Thomas lord Seimour hadde neuer been attainted, and as if no suche attaindour were or had been had, the corrupcion of bloude betwene the saied Thomas Lorde Seimour, and your subiecte, and her heires, or any acte of parlament, or Iudgement concerning the attindour of the saide Thomas Lorde Seimour, or any other thing, whereby the bloude of the saied Thomas Lorde Seimour is, or shoulde be corrupted, to ye contrarie in any wise notwithstanding.

Prouided alwaies and bee it enacted, by thaucthoritie aforesaied, that this present acte, or any thing therein conteined, extend not to restore or entitle your saied Subiecte, or any of her heires to any suche Honours, Castels, Lordshippes, Manours, Landes, Tenements, or other Hereditamentes, whiche your highnesse now hath or hadde, or is, might, or ought to bee intiteled to haue, by reason of any Attaindour or Attaindours, of thesaied Thomas Lorde Seimour, nor shall extende to any Honours, Castels, Lordshppes, Manours, Landes, Tenementes, Rentes, Reuersions, Seruices, or other Hereditamentes, late of the saide Thomas Lorde Seimour, whiche your highnesse hath heretofore geuen, dimised, exchaunged or graunted to any persone or persones, in Fee simple, Fee taile, or for, terme of life, lyues, or yeres, or at will, But that all suche Honours, Castels, Lordeshippes, Manours Landes, Tenementes, Reuersions, Seruices, and Hereditamentes whiche your Hignesse hathe geuen, dimised, exchaunged, or graunted as is aforesaied, Shall stande, Remaine, abide, And continue in thesame estate, force, degree, and condicion, to all intentes, construccions and purposes, as thei and euery of theim were before the making of this Acte, and as though this Acte hadde neuer been hadde nor made. Sauing to all and euery other persone and persones, bodies politique or corporate, their heires and successours, and to the heires and successours of euery of them, all such estate, possession, ryght, title interest, reuersion, remainder, lease and leases, claime, condicion, commons, and all other profeictes and commodities, as thei haue or ought to haue, out, in, or to the premisses, or any parte or parcell thereof, as though this act had neuer ben had ne made. And your saied subiect shal dailie praie to God for your most noble grace in honor long to cotinue

div.head: ¶ The .xv. Chapiter. ¶ An Acte against fonde and Phantasticall Prophecies.
div.p: WHere now of late Sithens the prorogacion of the last session of this present Parlament, diuers euill disposed persones, mynding to stirre and moue sedicion, disobedience & rebellion, haue of their peruerse mindes, feined, Imagined, inuented, published and practised diuers Phantasticall & fonde Prophecies, concerning the kinges Maiestie & diuers honorable persons, Gentlemen, and Commons of this Realme, to the great disturbaunce and peril of the kinges Maiestie, & this his realme: For remedie therof, be it ordeined & enacted by the king our Souuereine lorde, with thassēt of the lordes Spiritual & Temporal, and of the cōmons in this present Parlament assēbled, & by the auctoritie of thesame, that if any persone or persons, after the fist daie of Februarie next cōming, do set furth in writing, printing, singing, speaking, and publishe or otherwise declare, to any persone or persones, any phantastical or false Prophecie, vpon occasion of any armes, fieldes, beastes, foules, badges, and such other like thinges, accustomed in armes, coginsaunces, or Signetes. or by reason of any time, yere, or daie, name bloudshed or warre, to the intēt thereby to make any rebellion, insurrection, dissencion, losse of life or other disturbaūce, with in the Realme, or other the kinges dominions: That then euery suche persone thereof being lawfullie indicted, & conuicted, according to the due course of the lawes, for euery suche offence shall suffer imprisonmēt of his bodie, by the space of one yere, without Baile or Mainprise, and shall forfeict for euery suche offence the summe of ten poundes.

And if any suche offendour doe after suche cōuiction eftsones offende in any of the premisses, and be therof lawfullie indicted, and conuicted by the due course of the lawes, that then euery suche offendour shall for his secode offence & conuiccion, as is aboue saied, suffre imprisonment of his body, without baile or mainprise, during his life, and shall forfeict all his goodes, and cattalles, reals, and personales, the moities of eueri whiche forfeictures shalbe to the Kinge, and the other moities thereof to him, that shall or will sue for thesame in any of the Kinges Courtes of recorde, by accion. bil, plaint or informacion, in whiche case no essoine, wager of lawe, or proteccio shalbe allowed or admitted.

And be it farther enacted by the aucthoritie aforesaied, that all and euery Iustice of Assise. Iustice of Oier & determiner, Iustice of peace shal haue ful puwer and aucthoritie by vertue hereof, to enquire, heare, and determine al and euery offence, or offences abouesaied, commited, or doen within the limites of their commission, contrarie to the tenour and meaning of this acte.

Prouided alwaies and be it enacted, by thaucthoritie aforesaied, that no persone nor persones, shall at any time hereafter be empeched, for any offence hereafter to bee committed or doen, contrarie to this acte onlesse he be therefore empeched, or accused, within sixe Monethes next ensuing any such offence, by him or them committed to bee doen. And this act to endure to the end of the nexte Parlament.

div.head: ¶ The .xvi. Chapiter. ¶ An Acte touching the punishement of Vacabondes and other idle persons.
div.p: FOrasmuche as it is notoriouslie sene & knowen, that Vacabondes & beggars doe dailie encrease Within this ye Kinges highnesse realme into very great nūbres, chieflie by occasion of idelnesse, mother and rote of al vices, whereby doe ensue cōtinual theftes, murders, conspiracies and other soundrie heinous offences, & partelie for that the good and holsome lawes and Statutes of this realme, hath not been put in due execution, and partelie also, by reasō of ye multitude of thesame (thextremitie of some whereof haue been occasiō that they haue not been put in vre). Therfore & for diuerse good cōsideracions it is enacted by the king our Souuereine Lorde, with the assent of the lordes Spirituall & Temporal, and the commons in this present Parlament assembled, & by thauctoritie of the same, that the Statute made in the first yere of the kinges highnesse moste noble reigne concernīg idle persones and vacabondes in certaine cases, to be made slaues and so furth, and all and euery article, matier, prouiso, braunche and sentence therein conteined shalbe frō hensfurth vtterlie repealed, made frustrate, voide, and of none effecte.

And that the Statute, concerning how aged & impotent persones shoulde be ordred for their better Reliefe, & how Vacabondes & strōg beggars shoulde bee punished, made in the .xxii. yere of the late kinge of moste famous memorye kyng Henrie the eight, and euery matyer, article, prouiso, braūche, & sentence therein conteined, to be from hensfurth reuiued, made good, and stand in full strengthe and vertue and shal continue and remaine a perfeicte Act of parlament for euer.

And be it therfore enacted by thaucthoritie aforesaid, that all Iustices of peace, and euery of them within the limites of their commission and the Maiours, Shirifes, Bailifes, and other officers within their seueral Rules and offices, shal within their seuerall limites assemble together, and make their seuerall diuision, according to the purport and effecte of this acte, at the next general quarter Sessions of the peace to be holden after the feast of Easter nexte to come, for the due, spedie, and diligent execution of the same Acte. And that if any suche aged or impotent
person after the feast of easter nexte to come, shall offende contrarie to this Estatute, that then thesaied offendour shalbe vsed and punished, as in the same Estatute of the .xxii. of king Henrie theight, is prouided. And that before the feast of Easter no punishment shalbe put in execucion against any suche Impotent, Lame, and aged persone, but onely by the discrecion of the nexte Iustice of peace of the same Shire where suche offendour shalbe apprehended, any thinge in the saied acte to the contrarie notwithstanding.

And for the auoiding of the Idle loitering of common labourers of husbandrie, within this Realme: Be it enacted by the aucthoritie aforesaied, that suche common labourers being persones able in bodie, vsing loitering, and refusing to woorke, for suche reasonable wages, as is moste comonly geuen in the parties, where suche persones shall dwell shalbe for euerie suche times, as he or they refuse to laboure, hauīg reasonable wages, as is aforesaied, adiudged Vacabondes, and shalbe punished as strong, and mightie vacabondes, in suche maner and fourme as is declared in the saide act of .xxii. against vacabōdes. And touching maimed, lamed, and sore, aged, and impotent persons, whiche resorteth to the Citie of London, and to other Cities, Tounes, and Villages on begging: Be it enacted by the auctoritie aforesaied that all and singuler Maiours, Shirifes, Bailifes, Constables, or other heade Officers of any Citie, Toune, or Village, to whiche suche resorte is, or shalbe, shall before the feast of the Purification of oure Lady next folowing, see all suche Idle, impotent, maimed, and aged persones, who otherwist can not by their discrecions bee taken for vacabondes, whiche were borne within the saied Citie, Toune, or Village, or hath been there moste cōuersant and abiding by the space of three yeres, and now decaied, bestowed & prouided for, of the tenauntries, Cotages, or other conuenient houses, to be lodged in, at the Costes and Charges of the saied Cities; Tounes Boroughes, and Villages, there to be relieued, and cured by the deuocion of good people of the saied Citie, Boroughe, Toune, or Village, and that they doe not suffer after the time before rehersed, any other then suche as either were borne, or hath been for the moste parte conuersant, or abiding by the space of three yeres, as is aforesaied, in the saied Citie, Boroughe, Toune, or Village, to remaine & begge abroade within the precinctes of suche Cities, Tounes, Villages, or boroughes. Except it be suche as haue letters, or are aucthorised or licenced by force of this act, vpō peine that euery suche Maiours, Shirifes and bailifes, Constable, or other head officer by what name soeuer he be called, suffering any persone to begge within the precinct of his or their suche Iurisdiccion, other then is before rehearsed, for euery three daies, shall forfeict tenne shillinges, to whomsoeuer will sue therefore, by Bill, Informacion, or accion of debte, in any Courte of recorde, in the whiche sutes no Essoine, ne wager of Lawe, or proteccion shall bee
allowed for the defendaunt.

And be it further enacted by the aucthoritie aforesaied, that ye Maiour of the citie of London, and al other Maiours, Bailifes, Shirifes, Constables, and other head officers of euery Citie, Borough, or Toune corporat, and of euery other Toune and village, dooe with al conuenyēt spede by themselfes, or their sufficient deputies, before the feast of the Purification of our Ladie nexte comming, and so from tyme to tyme euery Moneth once, make a viewe and examinacion of aged, impotent and lame persones, beggers, as bee within the precincte of their Iurisdiction, and see all suche as were not borne, nor hath been for the moste parte conuersaunt and abiding by the space of three yeres complete, or haue not letters, and aucthorised or licenced by force of this Estatute, conueighed on horseback, Carte, or otherwise, as shal seme by their discrecions, to the next Constables, and they to conueie thesame to the next Constables, and so from Constables to Cōstables, till thesaied persones be brought to the place where thei were borne, or most conuersaunt and abiding, as is aforesaied, there to be prouided for, kepte, and nourished of almes as is aforesaied, vpō the peine that euery suche Maiour, Shirif, or Constable, headborough, or other head officers not making viewe, nor sending or conueiyng away, nor receiuing or not prouiding, as is before appointed, according to the true purporte, or meaning of this acte, to forfeicte for euery suche default ten shillinges, whereof the one halfe to be to the kinges vse, and thother to the partie, that wil sue therefore in any of the kinges Courtes of Recorde, by bil, informacion, accion of debt, in the which suites no essoine, wager of law, or protecciō shalbe allowed for the defendaunt.

Prouided alwaies, and bee it enacted by the aucthoritie aforesayed that if any of thesayed aged, maimed, or impotent persones of the cities Tounes, or villages, where they were borne in, or had their moste abiding, as is aforesayed, bee not so lame, or impotent, but that thei maie worke in some maner of worke: that then suche Citie, toune, parishe, or village dooe either in common prouide some suche worke for them, as they maie be occupied in, or appoincte them to suche as will finde them worke for meate and drinke. And if they refuse of wilfulnesse and stubbernesse to worke, or dooe runne awaie & begge in other places, then to punishe the same according to their discrecions, with stocking, beating, or otherwise, as shall seme to them conuenient.

Be it also enacted by thaucthoritie aforesaied, that all Leprouse and poore beddred creatures, whatsoeuer thei bee, maie at their awn libertie remaine and continue in suche houses appointed for leprouse or beddred people, as they now bee in, and shall not bee compelled to repaire into any other Countryes or places by vertue of this Acte, any thing therein contemed to the contrarie notwithstanding. And that also it shalbe lawefull vnto the saide Leprouse, and beddred people, for their
better Reliefe to appointe their proctour, or proctours, so there bee not appoincted aboue the numbre of twoo persones, for any one house of leprouse, or beddred people, to gather the charitable almes of all suche inhabitauntes, as shalbe within the compasse of foure miles of any of the saied houses of Leprouse and beddred persones.

Prouided alwaies and be it enacted by thaucthoritie afore saied, that it shalbe lawefull to the lord Chauncellour of Englande, or lorde keper of the greate Seale for the time beinge, at their discrecions, to graunt commission vnder the greate Seale of Englande, to euery or any persone or persones, that hath, or shall haue his or their houses, or barnes burnt, or suche losses, or to suche as bee or shalbe Leprous persones, to gather the reliefe and charitie of others for their reliefe, or for their aide and helpe of his or their losses, decaie or hinderaūce, as in time past hath been vsed, any thing in this acte notwithstanding.

And be it further enacted by the aucthoritie aforesaied, that all and euery Statute and acte of Parlament made for punishmente of Vacabondes, Slaues, aged and impotēt persones, or any of them, and euery article, sentence, clause, or prouiso therin conteined, other thē this presēt act and Statute made, & the saied act made in the saied .xxii. yere shall be from hensfourth vtterlie voide, repealed, and of none effecte or force.

And forasmuch as diuerse women and men going on begging, impotent and lame, & some able enoughe to laboure, doe carie children abouts with them of tendre age, and some of foure .v.vi. yeres of age or yonger or elder, whiche being once brought vp in idlenesse, will hardelie bee brought after to any good kinde of labour, peine, trauail, or seruice.

Be it enacted by thauctoritie aforesayed, ye if anye childe aboue thage of .v. yeres, and vnder thage of .xiiii. goe about wandering, as is aforesaied, or els alone, in case anye maner persone that is able to kepe anye suche childe will take it, be it male or female, of and from any suche begger beinge the father or mother thereof, nouricer or keper, whether they be willing or not, or without any suche nourice, father, mother or keper, by him or her selfe wādering, and bring such childe so taken, before one of the Cōstables of the parishe, where the childe shall so fortune to be taken vp, & at the next general quarter sessions to be holden in that Shire nexte to the place wher the saied taking vp shall fortune to bee, present the same in ye presence of the saied Constable, before the Iustice of peace at the same Sessions, and there in open Sessions promise to bring the same childe vp in some honest labour or occupacion, till the womā child come to thage of .xv. yeres, & the mā childe to thage of .xviii. yeres, if the Master or mastresse shal chaunce so long to lyue, that then and immediatly ye saied Iustices of peace by their discreciō shall adiudge by vertue of this acte, the saied childe, vnto the ages before specified, to be seruaūt or seruauntes to the saied persone or persones so taking and promising as is afore saied, suche childe to bee vsed and ordred, in all poinctes
according as the lawe, & custome of ye realme is of seruauntes without wages, to what labour, occupacion, or seruice soeuer thesaied taker vp, or Maister or mastres shal appoint him, or her, during thesaied terme, and the saied iudgement shalbe entred by the Clerke of the peace in the saied Sessions in fourme folowing. Memorandum, that at the Sessions of the peace holden at. w. the daie. &c. one I. B. of the toune of L. had deliuered to him, according to the forme of the Statute in that case prouided B.T. estemed to be of thage of seuen, or eight yeres, to be ordred according to the forme of the saied Statute.

And if it shall fortune suche child so adiudged to runne awaie at any time, ones, or mo times from his, or her maister, or maistres, that then it shalbe lawful for euery suche Maister, or Maistres, to take the sayed childe againe, and to kepe, and punishe the saied childe in the stockes, or otherwise by discrecion, or otherwise at the libertie of suche Maister, or maistres, to haue a warraunt from any Iustice af peace in ye same shire where the childe so runnes awaie, for suche childe running awaie, or going awaie, as is prouided by the statute of labourers, for suche Seruaunts as depart awaie from their Maister, or Maistres, without a reasonable cause before thende of their terme.

And that euery Iustice of Peace, shall by force of this acte haue aucthoritie, and power, to make suche warraunt against euery suche persō so going, and running awaie, in like forme as they, or any of them maie dooe against any seruaunt departing out of his maisters seruice without licence, or reasonable cause, and by force of the same warraunte the childe so running, or going awaie to be taken, and ordred in euery degree, as is prouided by the saied statute labourers for seruantes departing out of their maister, or mastres seruice, as is afore saied.

And be it further enacted by thaucthoritie afore saied, that if, and as often as it shal chaunce the father, mother, norice, or other bearer aboutes of the childe, or any other persone, or persones, to steale, or entice awaie any such child, adiudged for a seruaunt, as is afore saied, that thē, & so often it shalbe lawfull for the maister, or maistres of the same childe to be at his, or their libertie to take an accion vpon the statute Labourers against euery suche persō so stealing, or entising awaie suche child as he, or they might haue, by reasō of ye saied statute labourers, against him, or them that retaines any mannes seruant out of his Seruice, before thende of the saied terme, or els to take an accion of trespas against suche offendor, in whiche accion he shal recouer his dammages, & treble costes of his sute.

Prouided alwaies, and be it enacted by thaucthoritie afore saied, that if ye master, or mastres to whome such child, as is afore saied shalbe adiudged to bee Seruaunt, be vnreasonable in ordring, and bringing vp of suche childe, that then at all times vpon complainte made at the general quarter sessiōs of peace, in the countie where the saied child shalbe
by two honest neighbors of the same place, or toune wher ye saied childe shall fortune to be so vnresonably ordred, if it shall appere by honest witnesse to the iustices of peace at the same sessiōs, the cōplaint therof made shalbe true, then the iustices of peace at their general sessiōs in the same shire, where suche cōplaint shalbe made, shall by vertue of this act haue aucthoritie, and power to discharge ye saied childe from his, or their vnreasonable maister, or maistres, and appoint the same to some other honest maister, or maistres, vnto ye saied ages, to be ordred in euery degre, as ye saied childe shoulde haue been with his former maister or maistres & that ordre, and appoinctment to be written in the booke of the Clerke of the Peace, for the whiche entrie the saied clerke of the Peace shal haue iiii. d. for his labour, & not aboue, and in like maner shall haue .iiii. d. and not aboue, for the fyrst entrie of the chylde, to be seruant, as is aforesaid, to be paied be the maister, or maistres of the saied childe.

Prouided alwaies, and be it enacted, by thauctoritie aforesaid, that if the woman childe to be appointed a seruaunt, as is aforesayd, be maried before her age of .xv, yeres, that thē by that mariage, she shalbe discharged of seruice. This Acte, or any thing therin conteined to the contrarie notwithstanding.

Prouided alwaies, and be it enacted by thaucthoritie aforesayed, that all, and euery Vacabonde, or begger being borne in any other naciō, or coūtrie thē within this realme, shall in maner, & forme aforesayd and vppon the forfeictures, & penalties before mencioned, be cōueighed from place to place, or to the place, or Marches next adioining, to hys, or their natiue coūtrie, or to the next port, if there be a sea betwene thys realme, and his, or their saied countries, there to bee kept of thinhabytauntes of the said next porte, in conuenient labour from idlenesse, or otherwise til they maie be cōueighed ouer, and then at the costes of thinhabitauntes of the saied porte, if theimselues shall not haue wherewith, to be conueighed ouer into their natiue countries.

div.head: ¶ The xvii. Chapitre. ¶ An acte against vnlawful hunting in any parke, forest, chase, or other enclosed ground.
div.p:
WHere as in the first yere of your most gracious reygne your Maiestie in consideracion of the greate obedience that your subiectes then were in, of youre inestimable clemencie, and tendre loue borne vnto the same gaue your Roiall assente vnto an acte of parlament touching the repeale of certaine Statutes, the penalties whereof semed very sore, thinking moste Godlie thereby to winne your saied Subiectes, to the continuance of their obedience, rather by loue then feare, forasmuche as
sithen the time of the saied Repeale, your grace hathe founde the experience thereof, to haue hadde other Successe, then your moste mercifull meaning looked for, and that suche insolencies, and Barbarous vnrulines, and disobedience hath folowed the same, as heretofore hath not bene sene, either in this Realme, or elswhere. Amongest the whiche outragious disorders, one hath bene vnlawefull hunting, not onelye in all your Graces Subiectes seuerall groundes, but in your graces awne Parkes and Forestes, all moste through out the Realme, so notablie, as in some of your graces Parkes were slayne fiue hundred Dere in a daie within very fewe miles of your Maiesties Citie of London, whiche vnsufferable libertie escapinge without due punishement hath bred suche a bolde cotinuaunce of the like, as at this presente, bothe night and daie your graces Parkes and Forestes, and the Parkes also of others are still hunted with suche boldnesse as vnneth it is taken for a faulte, to the greate disquietnes of your graces kepers, and the destruccion of your Roiall games, beside the shame and dishonoure, that in other Realmes thereof is spoken. For reformacion thereof, moste humblie besechen your grace, youre Maiesties moste humble and louing Subiectes, that it maie bee ordeined and enacted, by your Maiestie, the Lordes Spirituall and Temporall, & the Commons in this presente Parlamente assembled, and by the aucthoritie of the same, that aswell one Estatute made in the Parlamente holden at westminster in the .xxxi. yere of the reigne of kinge Henrie the eyghte, touching the wrongefull entre into any Forest, Parke, or Chase, of the Kynges highnesse, the Quenes, the Princes, or any of the Kinges children, for the time being, or in to any other grounde of his, or theirs inclosed with wall, or Pale, ordeined or vsed for nourishing of Dere, as also one other Estatute made in the Session of the saied Parlament, holden in the .xxxii. yere of the reigne of the same late King touching the wrongefull taking, killinge, or sleing of any Dere, within any Parke, Chase, or closed grounde vsed for Dere, maie from the firste daie of Maye nexte comminge bee fully & clerelye reuiued and that the same Statutes with all and all maner of braunches, articles, Sentences, and Penalties of the same seuerall Estatutes, maye from the same daie be in full force, strengthe and vertue, to all ententes, constructions, and purposes, as if the same Estatutes, or any of them had neuer been repealed, the sayed Acte of repeale, or any other acte or thing to the contrarye in any wise notwithstanding. This Statute to endure the space of three full yeres to be complete and fullie ended, from the first daie of Maie abouesaied.

PROVIDED alwaies and be it enacted, that thys presente Acte or any thing therein conteined, shall not in any wise extende to cause the wife of suche Offendour or Offendours, to loose any dower, but that the wife and wiues of suche offendour and offendours, shall
haue suche interest and recouerie of, in, and to their Dower of the Landes, tenemētes, and hereditaments of suche offendour and offendours, as they shoulde haue had, in case no suche attaindour or conuiction had been had of any the offences afore saied. And that by suche attainder or conuiction, the heire of suche offendour or offendours shall lose no inheritaunce, ne suffre any corrupcion of bloude, but shall after the death of suche offendour and offendours, inherite and bee demed and adiudged as heire, and enabled as heire to suche offendour or offendours in suche maner and forme, as if no suche attaindour or conuiction had been had Any thing herein cōteined to the cōtrarie in any wise notwithstanding

div.head: The .xviii. Chapiter. ¶ An acte concerning Fee fermes mencioned. in the last Session.
div.p: WHere in the seconde Session of this present Parlament holden at Westminster vpō Prorogacion the iiii. daie of Nouembre in the second yere of ye reigne of our moste dreade Souuereigne Lorde the kinge that now is: Our Souereigne Lorde the Kinge of his moste godlie and vertuous disposicion, by thassent of the Lordes Spirituall and Temporal, and the Commons in the saied Parlamente assembled and by aucthoritie of the same, aswell for the aide and Reliefe of the poore in the Cities, boroughes, and tounes corporate of this his realme of Englande, and countrie of Wales, as for the execucion of other dedes of charitie, and common wealthe there ordeined & enacted, that suche Fee fermes and summes of moneie paied for feefermes, as by any Citie, Boroughe or Toune corporate, within this his Realme of Englande, or countrie of Wales, or by the bodies politique or corporate, officers or ministers of the same, shoulde or ought to bee due and payable to his Maiestie, his heires, or successours, during three yeres nexte ensuing after the .xiiii. daie of Marche, in the yere of our Lorde God. M. D. xlviii. shoulde ceasse and not bee due, ne paieable to his Maiestie ne his heires, or his successours by any suche Citie, Boroughe, ne Toune corporate, ne by any the bodies politique or corporate of theim or anye of them, nor by the Officers, inhabitauntes and ministers of the same Cities, Boroughes, or Tounes corporate, or any of them, and that the saied Acte shoulde bee to theim, and euery of theim, and to the successours of euery of them, a sufficient warraunt and discharge againste his Maiestie, his heires and Successours, for the reteining and withholding of the same Feefermes and summes of moneie, during the saied three yeres, and that no processe or other sute shoulde be at any time had or awarded against theim, or any of theim, out of the Exchequer, or any other Courte for the Arrerages thereof, for, or in any of the sayed three yeres.

And it was then ferther prouided and enacted by the saied aucthoritie, that asmuche of all, and euery suche summes of moneie, as shoulde or ought to be due to the kinges Maiestie, his heires or successours, by any Citie, Borough, toune corporate within Englande, or wales, or by the bodies politique of the same, or by any of the officers or ministers of the same, or any of theim, during ye saied three yeres, which might bee gathered and collected of the Issues, Fermes, and profeictes, for which the saied Feefermes shoulde haue be paied, in case the same had not been discharged by ye saied acte, shoulde be leuied, collected, gathered, paied & aunswered, as it shoulde haue been, if ye saied acte had not been made to be emploied and bestowed in, & about repairing of walles, bridges settīg poore people on worke, or other good dedes in euery suche Citie, Borough; or Toune corporat, where the same shoulde so haue been due, during the saied three yeres, if the saied Acte had not been made, by the discrecion and apoinctment of suche Commissioners, as the Kinges Maiestie shoulde particularlie aucthorise, & appoincte for euery suche Citie, Borough or toune corporate, in suche maner and fourme, as the same cōmissioners shoulde assigne, limite, and appoinct, or as by suche cōmission shoulde be declared or expressed, and not to the kinges Maiestie, his heires or successours in his courte of ye Exchequier, or in any other courte or place, to thuse of his Maiestie, his heires or successours. Neuerthelesse, for diuerse especiall cōsideracions, and weightie causes: Be it now enacted, ordeined and established, by aucthoritie of this present Parlamente, that the saied former acte, concerning the saied Feefermes and summes of moneie, and all articles, clauses, and prouisions, concerning the ordre, disposicion and paimētes of the same Feefermes and summes of moneie, or any of theim therin conteined, or of any annuitie or summes of monie out of thesaied Feefermes, and summes of moneie paied for Feefermes, shall stande, remaine, and bee in their full strength, power & effecte, onely for the first yere of the saied three yeres conteined in the saied acte, & not otherwise, ne for any longer time.

And that the saied act of Feefermes, and al articles, clauses, and prouisions therein conteined, touching and cōcerning the remitting, reteining, disposiciō, or paiemēt of the saied feefermes, or of any part or parcell thereof, of and for the last twoo yeres of the saied three yeres, shall vtterly ceasse, determine, and take none effect, any thing cōteined in the saied former acte, to the contrarie in any wise notwithstanding.

And furthermore be it enacted and established by thauctoritie aforesaied, that from and after the .xxiii. daie of marche in this present yere, of our lorde God. M.D.xlix. the saied feefermes, and sūmes of moneie paied for Feefermes, and euery of theim, shalbe due, paiable, and aunswerable vnto the kinges Maiestie, his heires, & successours, at suche times and places, and in suche maner, forme, and condicion, to all intentes, cōstructions and purposes, as the same, or any of them were, ought
or might haue been paied, or paiable before the making of the saied former acte, any thing therin conteined to the contrarie thereof notwithstanding.

Prouided alwaies & be it enacted by the aucthoritie aforesaied, that all & euerie patentee or patētees, and al other persones and bodies politique and corporate, their heires, successours and assignes, which by vertue of the letters patentes of the kinges Maiestie, or of any of his noble progenitours, or otherwise, at, and before the making of the saied former acte, had or enioied, or lawfullie shoulde, or might haue had, or enioied, any annuitie, or summe or sūmes of moneie going out, or to be takē or paieable of ye saied fee fermes, or sūmes of moneie paied for fee fermes, or any of thē, shal & maie lawefully claime, aske, demaūde, haue, and enioie suche annuitie or summes of moneie, as shalbe due, paiable, and aunswerable to any suche patētee or patentees, or any other persones or bodies politique & corporat, their heires, successours, & assignes, or any of them, from and after the saied .xiiii. daie of Marche, in ye saied yere of our lord God. M.D.xlix. at suche times and places, and in suche sorte, maner and fourme, to all intentes and purposes, as the same annuitie or summe or sūmes of moneie were paied or aunswered at, & before ye making of the saied former acte, and in none otherwise, any thing herein cōteined to the cōtrarie thereof in any wise not withstanding.

div.head: ¶ The .xix. Chapiter. ¶ An acte for the buiyng and selling or roather beastes and Cattal.
div.p: BE it enacted by the auctoritie of this present Parlament, that no persone nor persones, at any time frō and after the feast of the Annunciacion of our Ladie nexte comming, shal buie, or common, and cōclude to buie, any maner of Oxen, Steres, rontes, kien, heighfers, or calues, but onely in ye open faire or market, where the same shall happen to be brought and put to sale, and shal not sell the same againe on liue at and in the market or faire, where he bought the same during the time of the saied faire or market, vpon peine of forfeicture of the double value of suche cattall bought or solde, contrarie to the tenour of this present acte.

Prouided alwaie and be it ferther enacted by the aucthoritie aforesaied, that it shalbe lawefull for all and euery persone and persones, to buie any Oxen, Steres, Runtes, Kien, Heighfers, and Calues, or any of theim, out of any open faire, or market, for his or their prouision, for their housholde, teme, or dairie, at his or their will, or pleasure, to bee imploied, and spente onely in keping and maintenaunce of his or their house, or for their Teme or Dairie, and not otherwise.

And be it ferther enacted, by ye aucthoritie abouesaied, that no person,
being a Butcher, and vsing the crafte or mistery of butcherie, shall at any time after the saied feast buie any fatte oxen, steres, rontes, kine, heighfers, calues, or shepe, and selle, or cause to be solde thesame againe on liue, vpon peine of forfeicture of euery suche oxe, stere, Ronte, Cowe, Heighfer, Calues, or shepe, bargained, or solde contrarie to the forme of this present acte.

Prouided alwaie, that all, and euery persone, and persones beyng a Butcher, and vsing theart, and misterie of Butcherie, shal and maie at his, and their will, and pleasure buy any fat oxen, steres, Runtes, Kien, heighfors, calues, and sheepe, or any of them, out of any open faire, or market: So that such butcher sel not, nor cause to be solde thesame againe on liue, as is aforesaied, any thing conteined in this acte to ye cōtrarie not withstanding. Thone moitie of all wiche forfeictures, shalbe to our Souereigne lorde the king, his heires, and Successours: and thother moitie to him, or theim that will sue for thesame in any of the kinges Courtes of Recorde, wherin no wager of lawe, essoine, or protection shalbe allowed for the defendaunt or defendauntes. This acte to endure to thende of the nexte parlament.

div.head: ¶ The .xx. Chapiter. ¶ An acte touching the repeale of a certaine braunche of an acte passed in the last Session of this parlament, concerning victuallers and Artificers
div.p:
WHere by a certeine acte made in the Parlamēt holden at westminster by prorogacion the .iiii. daie of Nouembre, in the seconde yere of the reigne of our most dread souereigne lorde the king that now is, it is enacted, and established, that no persō, or persōs should at any time after the first day of Aprill thē next ēsuing, interrupt, denighe, let, or disturbe any fre Masō, Rough Masō, Carpēter, brickelaier Plaisterer, Ioiner, Hardehewer, Sawier, Tiler, Pauier, glaster limeburner, brickmaker, tilemaker, plummer, or labourer borne in this realme, or made denizen, to worke in any of the saied craftes in any citie borough, or toune corporate, with any persō, & persōs, that wil reteine him, or thē, albeit the saied persō, or persons so reteined, or any of thē do not inhabit, or dwel in ye citie, boroughe, and toune corporat, where he or they shal worke, nor be free of the same citie, boroughe, or toune, any Statute, lawe, ordinaunce, or other thing what soeuer before hadde, or made to the contrarie, in any wise not withstanding, and that vpon peine of forfeicture of fiue. l. for euery interupcion, or disturbaunce doen contrarie to thesaid Estatute, thone moitie of euery suche forfeiture to be to the king, & thother moitie therof to be to him, or them that
will sue for thesame in any of the Kinges courtes of Recorde, by bille, plaint, action of debt, or informacion, wherin no wager of law, essoine, nor proteccion shoulde bee allowed, as by the saied acte of Parlamente emonges other thinges more plainely appeareth.

And forasmuche as in the citie of London being the kinges chambre, and most auncient citie of this realme, the artificers, and Craftesmen of the artes, craftes, and misteries afore saied, are at great costes, & charges, aswell in bearing, and paiyng of taxes, tallages, Subsidies, Scot, Lot, and other charges, aswell to the kinges Maiestie, as to the saied citie, and at manie and sondrie triumphes and other times for the kinges honour, and that if Forreines should come, and worke emonges theim, within the liberties of the saied citie, contrarie to their auncient priuileges, that the same should be a great decaie of conning, and an inpouerishment, and driuing awaie of the fre men, being artificers of the Craftes, and Artes, and misteries aforesaied, within the saied Citie of London, to the great hurt, or destruccion of the saied Citie.

For reformacion wherof, the kinges maiestie is pleased, and contented, that it be enacted by thaucthoritie of this present parlament, with the assent of the Lordes Spirituall, and Temporall, and the commons in this present parlament assembled, that the saied acte onelie touching tharticle, and clause aforesaied, and al, & euerie sentence, and braunche conteined in the saied acte, concerning thesame article, shal fromhensfoorth be resumed, repealed, adnulled, reuoked, adnihilated, & vtterlie made voide for euer. Any thing cōteined in ye saied former acte touching the clause, or article aforsaide, in any wise to ye cōtrarie notwithstāding

div.head: ¶ The .xxi. Chapiter. An Acte for the buiyng, and selling of Butter, and Chese.
div.p: BE it enacted by thaucthoritie of this present Parlamēt, that no persone, or persones, after the feast of the Annunciaciō of our Ladie nexte comming, shall buie to sel againe any butyre, or chese, onlesse he or they sel ye same againe by retaile, in opē shop faire, or market, and not in grosse, vpō pein of forfaicture of ye double value of thesame Butter, & Chese so solde, cōtrarie to the tenour of this present acte: thone moitie of al whiche forfeictures to be to our souereigne lorde the king, his heires, and successours, and the other moitie to him, or theim that will sue for thesame in any of the kinges courtes of record wherin no wager of lawe, essoine, or proteccion shalbe allowed for the defendaunt, or defendauntes.

Prouided alwaies, and be it enacted by the authoritie aforesaied, that the saied worde of retaile mencioned in this acte, shalbe expounded
declared and takē, onely where a weight of Cheese, or a barrel of butter or of lesse quantitie, and not aboue shalbee solde at one time to any persone or persones in open shop, faire, or market, and that to be doen without fraude or couine.

Prouided alwaie, that this acte or any thing therin conteined shall not extende to any Inholder or victailer for suche butter or Cheese, as shalbe spent, or vttered by retaile, in any of their houses, any thing conteined in this acte to the contrarie notwithstanding: this act to endure to the nexte Parlament.

div.head: ¶ The .xxii. Chapiter. ¶ An acte touching the retaining of Iourneimen by diuerse persones.
div.p: WHere as many yong folkes and seruauntes of sundrie occupaciōs, being once out of their apprēncehodes, or their yerelie reteined seruice, will not commonlie be reteined in seruice by ye yere, nor laboure in their Sciēces, Occupacions, or Craftes wherein thei bee exercised or brought vp, but at their libertie, by ye daie, weke, or otherwise, worke by great, to thintent they will liue idlie & at their pleasure, flie and resorte from place to place, whereof ensue more inconueniences then can be at this present expressed and declared.

Be it therefore enacted by the aucthoritie of this Parlament, that no persone nor persones occupiyng or vsing, or that hereafter shal occupie or vse any of the artes, misteries, occupacions, craftes or sciences of a clothemaker, fuller, shermā, weiuer, tailor or shomaker, shal after the feast of Pentecoste nexte comming, hire or reteine to woorke in any of their artes, misteries, occupacions, craftes, or Sciences, any persone or persones vnmaried, as a Iourneiman, yt is to saie, to worke or labor by the daie or taile worke, or by the great, or for any time or terme, vnder the time & terme of one whole quarter of one whole yere. And that no persone nor persones vnmaried shalbe hired or reteined with any of the persone or persones aforesaied, to worke in any of the artes, misteries, occupaciōs, craftes, or sciences aforesaied, for any lesse time, thē for the space of one whole quarter of one whole yere, vpon peine of euery persone offending contrarie to this Statute to suffer imprisonment for one whole moneth without baile or mainprise, & to forfeicte for euery suche offence .xl.s̄.

And be it enacted by thauctoritie aforesaied that euery iourneiman of any the craftes, occupaciōs or misteries aforesaied, being required by any persone or persones vsing the misteries, occupacions, craftes or sciences aforesaied, or any of them, to serue by the quarter of the yere, halfe yere, or whole yere vpon suche reasonable wages as betwene thē shalbe agreed, & in case where ye parties cannot accord, thē for such wages as
shalbe adiudged & decreed by one Iustice of the peace, maior, aldermā, Bailife, Portreue, Constable, or tithing man of the Shire, Citie, toune borough, village, hundred, wapētake, or tithing, where any suche Iurneiman shalbe required to serue, as is abouesaied, & there vpō if suche Iourneman refuse to serue in maner and fourme abouesaied, that then euery suche Iourneiman and euery of them so refusing to serue, as is abouesaied, shall suffer imprisonment, by the space of one whole moneth and shall at euery time so refusing forfeict. xx.s̄.

And be it ferther enacted, that al and euery person or persons, that shal haue .iii. aprentices in any of the saied craftes, misteries, or occupacions, shal reteine & kepe one Iourneiman, and for euery other apprētice aboue the numbre of thesaied .iii. apprentices one other iournemā vpon peine for euery default .x.l. the one halfe of al whiche forfeictures, shalbe to the kyng our Souereigne lorde, and thother half to suche persone or persones, as wil sue for thesame in any of the kinges courtes of Recorde, by bill, informacion, accion of debt, or otherwise, in whiche suit no essoine, proteccion, or wager of lawe, shalbe admitted or allowed.

And it is ferther enacted by thauctoritie abouesaied, that al and singular thoffences abouesaied, whiche shalbe hereafter cōmitted or doen, contrarie to the tenour of this present acte, shalbe inquirable & presentable before ye Iustices of Oyer and Determiner, Iustices of Assises, Iusticez of the Peace, and in all and euery lete or letes, before the Stewarde or stewardes there, and before any Maior, bailife, or other head officer, of any Citie, Toune, or borough corporat, and that the saied Iustices, stewarde, Maiour, Bailife, or other head officer, shal haue full power and aucthoritie from time to time to punishe and correcte, all and euery persone and persones offending contrarie to the tenour of this present act, according to suche presentment or presentmentes, as before him or thē shalbe had or made.

Prouided alwaies, & be it enacted by thaucthoritie aforesaied, that all seruauntes of husbandrie vnmaried, and whiche haue not been maried, and all seruauntes and labourers vsing to labour in barges commonlie called Westerne barges, which are not, nor haue been maried, shall after the feast of the Annunciacion of our Ladie next comming, serue by the hole yere and not goe by the daie wages, vpō peine of suche punishment as is conteined in the Statutes made against labourers, and that all suche seruauntes shall after thesaied feast geue their Master & Maistresse a quarters warning, against his, or their departure out of seruice vpon the like peine conteined in thesaied Statute.

div.head: ¶ The .xxiii. Chapiter. ¶ An acte concerning the release of the braunches in the last acte of the Reliefe, for the paimentes of shepe and Clothes, and also of a graunt of a Subsidie to be paied in one yere.
div.p:
MOste humble praing the Communs in this present Parlemente assambled, your moste excellēt maiestie, that where in ye last Sessiō of this present Parlament vpon prorogation, begō at Westminster the .iiii. daie of Nouēbre, in ye second yere of your highnesse reigne, and there continued vnto ye .xiiii. daie of Marche thē next folowīg, your hūble, & faithfull Subiectes ye Cōmōs, in the saied parlament assembled, with thassent of ye lordes Spirituall, and temporal, graunted vnto your highnesse one relief of .iii.s̄. of euery l. of the goodes, and Cattals, of euery persone beyng woorth .x,l. & vpwarde, to be leuied, & taken in .iii. yeres, in maner, and forme as is mentioned in thesaid acte. And also one other relief, to be taken & leuied, for euery shere shepe, accompting ye same by the polle, after ye rate, as by thesame acte more at large it doth appere. And one other relief of viii.d of the .l. of the price, and value of all, and singuler wollen Clothes to be taxed, and leuied, in maner, and forme, as by thesame acte is declared: Thesame seueral reliefes to endure, and to be yerelie paied, and leuied during thre yeres, as by the same former acte, more largelie it appereth: whiche Relief of Clothe apperethe now, so comberous to all Clothmakers, & also so tedious to thesame, for makinge, of their bookes and the accomptes therof, by reason of lacke of the alnagers not alwaies presēt, whē time requireth, that in maner thei are discouraged to make any cloth, or to set any mē on worke about thesame: and also the said relief of shepe is to your poore commons, hauing but few shepe in nombre a great charge, and also so comberous for all your Commissioners, and officers, named, and appointed for executing of the same, that thei cannot tel, how to serue your highnesse ther in according to their dueties It maie therfore please your highnesse, with thassent of the lordes spirituall, and Temporal and of your saied Commōs, and at their moste humble sute, that it be enacted, by the aucthoritie of this present parlament, that the seueral graunts, and clauses, mencioned in the said acte of reliefe, concerning or touching onely the seuerall grauntes of Reliefes to bee leuied, and paied for shepe after the rate of the polle, and of clothe to be paied, or of any of them, as in the former act is recited, and euery article, clause, prouision, and sentence, concerning onely the same seueral grauntes of reliefes for shepe, and clothe, or either of thē, shalbe from the said .iiii. daie of Nouembre, in the said second yere of your most noble riegne, deined & adiudged voide, and of none effect, and to be vtterlie repealed, to al intentes, constructions, and purposes. And that euery article, clause, and prouision mencioned in thesaied acte of reliefe, touching, or concerning the relief, of, and for gooddes, to stande, and be good, and effectual, according to the tenor of thesame act of relief. And we your humble, & obedient Subiectes, beseche your highnesse, that it
maie please your highnesse, to take, and receiue of vs your said subiectes towardes your inestimable charges, that you haue alreadie susteined and borne, and be lyke herafter to susteyne, and beare, for the defence of vs, and this your highnesse realme, and dominions, against tholde, and auncient enemies of the same, the Frenchemen, and the Scottes, nowe beyng open enemies to your highnesse, your saied realme, & dominions this small gyft hereafter folowing, not as any recompence, or satisfaction to your maiestie, of, and for your most bountifull, and liberall relesse, and dyscharge of your sayed humble subiectes, of, and concernyng the sayed seuerall reliefes of shepe, and clothes, but as a token, and knowledge of our faithfulnesse, louing, and willyng hartes, towardes your highnesse, to be alwaies readie, to beare with your highnesse, to the vttermost of our powers, in all your procedynges, and affaires, as to the duetie of naturall, & obedient subiectes apperteineth: that is to say: we your graces saied louing subiectes, dooe, by aucthoritie of thys present parlament, frely, and of our good hartes, and myndes, geue, and graūt vnto your most royall maiestie, one other reliefe, to continue by one yere next ensuing the determination of the sayed three yeres specified in the sayed former acte of reliefe, for goodes to be rated, taxed, leuied, and gathered of euery persone, of what estate or degree he be, accordyng to the tenour of thys acte after the rate, and in maner, and fourme folowyng, that is to saye, aswell of all, and euery persone, as is, or herafter shalbe, your graces natural subiectes, as of all, and euery Fraternitie, Guilde, Corporation, Misterie, Brotherhod, Compaignie, and Commonaltie, corporate, or not corporate, within this Realme of Englande, Wales, and other the kynges dominions, beyng woorth .x. pounde of money, Coygne, plate, stocke of merchandise, Corne, Grayne, shepe, Beastes, cattals, or other goodes moueable, aswel within this realme, as without, & of all such sūmes of money, as to him or thē shalbe owing, wherof he, or they trust in theyr consciences surely to be paied .xii.d. of euery li. And of euery alien, or straunger, borne out of the kynges obeysaunce, aswel denisen, as not denisen, inhabiting, or resiant within this realme or any other the kinges dominions, being worth .x.li. in money, coigne, Plate, stocke of Merchaundise, Corne, Grayne, sheepe, Beastes, Cattals, or other goodes moueable, aswell within this realme, as without, and of all such summes of money, as to him is, or shalbe owing, wherof he trusteth in his conscience to be surely paied .ii.s̄. of euerye li. And of euery Alien, or straunger, borne out of the kynges obeysaunce, aswell Denison, as not denison, inhabiting, or resiaunt within this realme, or any other the kinges dominions, beyng woorth .xx.s. and vnder .x.li. in money, coygne, Plate, stocke of Merchaundise, Corne, Grayne, shepe, beastes, cattall, or other goodes moueable, aswell within this realme as without, and of all suche summes of money, as to hym, is, or shalbe owing, wherof he trusteth in hys conscience to be surely payed .xii.d. of
euery pounde. Except, & out of the premisses deducted, suche summes of Money, as any persone or persones before chargeable owe, and in hys or their conscience truly mynde to pay. And excepted also the apparell of such persones, their wiues, & chyldren, belongyng to their awne bodies, sauyng Iewelles, golde, syluer, Stone, and Pearle. Excepted also alwaies from the charge, Assessement, and payment of the saied reliefe, all money, gooddes, and Cattals of orphanes, bequethed or left vnto them by their parentes, or other their Frendes deceassed. And that all Plate, coigne, Iewelles, gooddes, debtes, and cattalles personal, being in the rule and custodie of any persone, or persones, to the vse of anye Corporacion, Fraternitie, Guilde, Misterie, Brotherhead, Companye, or any Commonaltie beyng corporate, or not corporate, be and shalbe rated, set, and charged, by reason of this acte, at the value certified by the presentours of the certificat, to be sworne of euery pounde in gooddes and debtes, as is aboue saied, and the summes that are before rehearsed, set and taxed, to be leuied and takē of them, that shal haue such gooddes in custodie, as is before rehearsed. And the same persone or persones, and bodie corporate, by the aucthoritie of thys acte, shalbe dyscharged agaynst him or them, that shall, or ought to haue the same, at the tyme of the payment, or deliuerie therof, or at his otherwise departure from the custodie, or possessiō of the same. Excepted alwaies & foreprised from the charge and assessemēt of this reliefe, all gooddes, cattals, Iewels, and ornamentes of churches and chapelles, ordeyned and vsed in churches or chapelles, for diuine seruice therin to be celebrated.

Also we the kinges maiesties louing and obediēt subiectes, doe geue and graunt to your highnesse .viii.d. to be paied in thesame yere by euery other persone not borne vnder the kynges obeisaunce, beyng Denizen, or not denizen, other then women couert, souldiours, and such persones as be vnder the age of .xii. yeres, dwelling or resiant within thys realme or any other the kynges dominions. And the sayed Reliefes shalbe, by auctoritie aforesaied, taxed, assessed, and rated in the sayed yere, in euery Shire, Ridyng, Lath, Wapentake, Rape, citie, borough, towne, and euery other place, within thys realme of Englande, and Wales, & other the kinges dominions, in fourme following, that is to say, before the .xx. day of Ianuary, which shalbe in the yere of our Lorde God. M.D.Li. & the paiment therof to be had, made, & paied at the receipt of the kinges Exchequier, betwene the fyrst daye, & the .xx. day of Aprill, whiche shall be in the yere of our lord God. M.D.Lii. And the sūmes abouesayed, of and for the saied reliefe, shalbe taxed, set, asked, & demaūded, taken, gathered, leuied, & paied, vnto ye vse of our saied souereigne lord, his heires and successours, in fourme aboue saied, aswell within Liberties, frauncheses, Sanctuaries, auncient demeasne, and other whatsoeuer place exempte, or not exempte, as without. Excepte suche shires, places, and persones as shalbe foreprised, in, and by this present acte, anye graunt,
charter, prescripcton, vse or libertie, by reason of any letters patentes, or other priuilege, prescripciō, allowance of the same, or whatsoeuer other matter of discharge heretofore to the contrary made, graunted, vsed, or obteyned, notwithstandyng. And it is ferther enacted, by the aucthoritie of this present Parlament, that euery such persone, aswell suche as be borne vnder the kynges obeysaunce, as euery other persone straūger borne, denizen, or not denizen, inhabiting within this realme or within Wales, or other the kynges dominions, whiche at the tyme of the sayed assessing, or taxacion to be had or made, shalbe out of thys realme and out of Wales, and haue gooddes or Cattalles within this realme or in Wales, shalbe charged and chargeable for the same, by the certificat of thinhabitauntes of the parties where such gooddes, cattalles, or other the premisses then shalbe, or in such other place, where suche persone, or hys factor, deputie, or attourney, shall haue hys most resort vnto, within this Realme, or in Wales, in lyke maner, as if thesame persone were, or had been, at the tyme of thesame assessement, within thys Realme, or wales. And that euery persone abyding within thys realme, or without thys realme, shalbe charged and chargeable to the same reliefe graūted by this acte, accordyng and after the rate of the value of hys substaūce, gooddes, & cattalles, & other premysses, as suche persone so to be charged, shalbe set at, in the tyme of the sayed assessing or taxacion, vpō them to be made, and in none otherwyse.

Prouyded alway, and be it ferther enacted, by auctoritie aboue sayed, that all and euery taxacion, and assessement of the saied relief for gooddes, or for any former graunt, or subsidie heretofore had, made, graunted, or taxed (foreprised, and excepted the saied seuerall reliefes, for shepe and clothe, and eyther of them) shalbe takē, iudged, and demed, of good force, strength, and effecte, to all intentes, constructions, and purposes, and shalbe leuied and paied to your highnesse accordyngly.

And be it ferther enacted, by the aucthoritie aboue sayed, that the lorde Chauncellour of Englande, or the lorde keper of the great Seale for the tyme beyng, the Commyssioners in that behalfe, by the Kynges Commission to be appoincted, and aucthorised, the presentours, the persone presented, chargeable, or taxed, Collectours, petit Collectours, barons of the kinges Exchequer, Auditours, and all and euery other persone and persones, mencioned in the saied former acte of Reliefe, shall by auctoritie of this present act, make, doe, and execute all and euery thing and thinges, concerning the sayed reliefe graunted by this present acte, as is conteyned, limitted, and appoyncted to them by the sayed former acte of Reliefe for gooddes, and vpon lyke peynes, fynes, amerciamētes and forfeyctures, and in such and the same maner, fourme, estate, & condicion, to all intentes, constructions, & purposes, as they or any of them are appoincted, myght, may, shoulde, or ought to doe, & execute by aucthoritie of the sayed former acte, touching the relief for gooddes, and as
though euery clause, article, sentence, and matter mencioned in the saied former acte, concerning or touching the sayed Reliefe for gooddes, were specially and particularly recited, and mencioned in this present acte.

Prouyded alwaies, that this graunt of Reliefe, nor any other thyng therein conteined, doe in any wise extende, to charge the inhabitauntes or dwellers within Irelande, Bullome, and the coūtie of the same, Calice, Hāmes, Guysnes, & the marches of ye same, Iernesey, & Gernesey, Alderney, and Silleye, or any of them, of, for, or cōcerning any goodes, whiche the sayed inhabitauntes, or dwellers, or anye other to their vse, haue within Irelande, Bulloin, the coūtie of ye same, Calice, Hammes, Guisnes, or other marches of the same, Ierneseye, Gernesey, Alderneie, and Silleye, or in any of them.

Prouyded also that the sayed graunt of reliefe, doe not in any maner of wyse extende, or be preiudiciall or hurtefull to the inhabitauntes, or Resiauntes at this present tyme, within the fyue Portes Corporate, or to any of theyr membres incorporate, or vnited to the same fiue Portes, or to any of the same fiue Portes, or to any of the inhabitauntes within the liberties of Romney Mershe, of, or for any part or parcel of the sayed summes graunted in this present Parlament, of the saied inhabitaūtes now resiantes, or any of them to be taxed, set, asked, leuied, or paied, but that the sayed inhabitauntes, and nowe resiauntes of the sayed Portes of Romney mershe, and theyr membres, and of euery of them, be, and shalbe of, and from the sayed graunt and payment of the sayed Reliefe, during theyr resiauncie there, and not longer, acquited and discharged, any matter, or whatsoeuer thing in this present act, made, or had, to the contrary notwithstanding.

Prouyded also, that this present acte of Reliefe, ne any other thyng therin conteined, extende to any of the Englyshe inhabitauntes, or resiauntes in any of the Counties of Northumberlande, Comberlande, Westmorlande, the toune of Barwike, the towne of Newecastell vpon Tyne, and the Byshoprike of Duresme, nor to anye of them, of, for, and concerning any gooddes, or Cattalles, whiche the same inhabitauntes or dwellers, or any other to theyr vse, haue within the sayed Counties, of Northumberlande, Cumberlande, and Westmorlande, or the toune of Barwike, the Towne of Newcastle vpon Tyne, or the Byshoprike of Duresme, or any of them, but that they, and euerye of them shalbe of, and for their gooddes lying and beyng in the sayed counties, Tounes, and Bishoprike, or of anye of them, vtterlye acquyted and dyscharged, any thing in this present act before rehearsed, to the contrary notwithstandyng.

Prouyded also, that thys Acte, ne any thing therein conteined, shall extende to the gooddes of anye College, Halle, or Hostle, within the Vniuersities of Oxforde & Cambridge, or any of them, or to the gooddes of the College of Winton founded by Byshop Wickham, or to the
goodes of the College of Eton next Windesore, or to the goodes of any Reader, or Scholer within the saied Vniuersities, and colleges, or any of them there remaining for studie, without fraude, or couine, anye thing in this acte conteined to the contrarye in anye wyse notwithstandyng.

Prouided alwaies, and bee it enacted by the auctoritie aforesayed, that al, and euery collectour, petite Collectour, and other persone, and persons, that haue leuied, gathered, or receiued any summe, or summes of moneie of any person, or persons, for the Relief of Shepe, and clothe, or either of them, shall before the last daie of Februarie next comminge, repaie, and deliuer to euery soche persone and persons, his, or their Executours, or administratours, al, and euery thesame sūme, and sūmes of money so by them, or any of them receiued, vpō peyne of forfeicture double the value of euery such summe, or sūmes of money so by them, or any of thē receiued, & not repaied before the saied last day of Februarye. For the which forfaiture, the partie greued, shall, and maye haue his remedye by accion of debt, byll, playnt, or informacion, in anye of the kynges courtes of Recorde, where no wager of lawe, essome, or protection shall be allowed.

Prouyded also, and be it enacted, by the sayed aucthoritie, that all & syngular sūmes of money, as now be, or hereafter shalbe payed by anye collectour, or petit collectour, or other persone to the kynges vse in hys receipte, or elswhere, for the reliefes of Shepe, and clothe, or eyther of them, shalbe deliuered, & repaied to the sayed collectour, his executours, or administratours, at, & vpon his, or theyr request in the sayed receipt, to the vses, and intentes aboue saied, and that thys act shall be a sufficient warraunt to thofficers of the kinges receipte, to repaye and deliuer the same to the saied Collectour, hys Executours, or administratours, without any farther, or other warrant to be sued for, to the kinges highnesse in that behalfe.

Prouyded also, and be it enacted, by the aucthoritie aforesaied, that thys act of graunt of reliefe, shall not extende to anye spirituall persone or persones, for any of his, or theyr gooddes, or cattalles: and forasmuch as diuers and sundry the kynges Maiesties tenauntes, and other the inhabitauntes, & dwellers within the counties of Penbroke, Carmarthen, Cardigan, Glamorgā, Brecknock, Radnor, Moūtgomery, Denbigh, Flynt, Merioneth, Anglesey, Carnaruan, and of the countie Palentine of Chester, be at thys present tyme charged, & chargeable with the seuerall paiementes of diuers great summes of money by the name of a Mise due to his maiestie accordyng to the seuerall customes of the sayed counties, for the paiement wherof, dyuers & sundry the gentlemē, and other inhabitauntes of the sayed counties, be, and stand bounde to hys hyghnesse: The king our souereygne lorde is therfore pleased, and contented, that it be prouyded, ordeyned, and enacted by thaucthoritie
