afore saied, that this Acte or any thinge therein conteined, shall not extende to charge anye of the kynges maiesties tenauntes, and other inhabitauntes, and dwellers, within any of the sayed counties, of Penbroke, Carmarthen, Cardigā, Glamorgā, Brecknock, Radnor, Moūtgomerie, Denbigh, Flynt, Merioneth, Anglesey, Carnaruan, and the countie of the Palantine of Chester, beeyng charged, or chargeable, with the sayed Mise, for, or within any of the paymentes of the saied relief graunted to the kinges maiestie by this acte, or by the saied former acte, vntill the seuerall daies, and tymes appointed, & graunted, for the paymētes of the sayed Mises shalbe expired. And that the first paymēt of the sayed relief graunted by this acte, and the sayed former acte, shall be made at the receipte of the kinges Exchequer, before the fyrst day of Maye then next following, after the daye appoincted for the latter paiment to be made of the sayed Mise, and so yerely, before the first daye of Maye, at the receipte of the sayed Exchequer, vntyll the foure seuerall paymentes of the sayed relief be fully made, in suche, and lyke fourme, & ordre, as is ordeyned, & appoynted by this acte, and by the sayed former acte for the Kynges subiectes, concernyng the sayed Reliefe to be made at the receipte of the sayed Exchequer, accordyng to the tenour of thys present acte, and of the sayed former acte. Thys acte, and the sayed former acte, or any thing in them, or eyther of them conteined, to the contrary, in any wise notwithstanding.

div.head: ¶ AN ACTE OF THE KINGES MAIESTIES MOSTE FREE and generall pardon. ¶ The .xxiiii. Chapitre.
div.p:
THE kinges most Roiall Maiestie right well perceiuīg his louing subiectes by many, and sondrie waies and meanes, greuouslie against ye bounden duties of their allegeaunces, to haue now of late this last sommer time offēded his highnesse, and his lawes, by inordinate disobedience, rebellion, and otherwise, & his maiestie by goddes prouidence beīg replenished with mercie, clemencie, and pitie, & muche enclined to allure, prouoke, and styrre his saied louing subiectes to loue obedience, which to them of dutie apperteineth, his maiestie hauing a speciall trust, & confidence in his sayed subiectes, that they will herafter applye, and indeuour themselues to serue, and please hym in all obedience, and obseruance of his lawes, which hys highnesse willeth, and chargeth them to doe, lest vpon suche like disobedience, rebellion, and other offences, hys highnesse shalbe enforced, and constreigned to execute his seuere iustice, which to hys imperiall, and Kyngly estate, and function doeth apperteyne, and maye, nor will no lenger beare, and susteyne herafter any such rebellion, being a great peryll to hys graces persone, and clere subuersion, and a likelye destruction of hys saied realme, and Subiectes, and a great comforte to all his graces enemies: is fully, and resolutely contented, and pleased that it be enacted by aucthoritie of thys present Parlament, in maner, and fourme folowing. That is to say, that all & euery of hys sayed subiectes, aswell spirituall, as temporall, of thys hys realme of Englande, Wales, the Isles of Iernesey, and Gernesey, Barwicke, Calleis, Guisnes, Hammes, Bulloigne, and Bulloignois, and the marches of euery of them, Theyres, successours, executours, and administratours of thē, and euerye of them, and all and syngular bodies in anye maner of wyse corporate, Cities, Boroughes, shyres, Ridynges, Hundredes, Lathes, Rapes, Wapentakes, Townes, Vyllages, and Tythinges, and euery of them, and the Successour, and Successours of them, and euerye of them, shalbe by thaucthoritie of thys present Parlament, acquyted, perdoned, released, and dyscharged against the Kynges hyghnesse, hys Heyres, successours, and Executours, and euery of them, of all maner of Heresies, Treasons, rebellions, Insurrections, vnlawfull assemblies, Conuenticles, Conspiracies, Misprisions of Treason, Concealemētes of Treason, Murdres, Fellonies, Robberies, Offences, Contemptes, Trespasses, Wronges, Deceiptes, Misdemeanours, Forfaictures, Penalties, Sommes of money, Paines of Death, Peines Corporall, and Pecuniarie, & all other thinges, Causes, Quereles, Sutes, iudgemēts
and executions, which may be, or can be by his hyghnes in any wise, or by any meanes perdoned, or released, or dyscharged, before, & vnto the xxii. day of Ianuary, in the yere of our lord God. M.D.xlix. other then suche as hereafter in this acte be excepted, and foreprised, in such maner and fourme, and vnto suche tymes as the same be excepted, or forprised in thys acte, and other then such as the clauses of prouiso hereafter mēcioned, doe, or doeth extende vnto.

And also the kynges highnesse is further contented, and pleased, that it be enacted by thaucthoritie of thys present parlament, that this hys sayed general, and free pardon shalbe as good, and effectual in the law, to euery of hys sayed subiects, bodies corporate, and other before rehersed, and to euery of them by the saied generall wordes before rehersed in all thinges, which be not herafter in this present acte excepted, or forprised, nor conteined in anye clause of prouiso herafter mencioned, as that same pardon should be if all offences, contemptes, forfaictures, causes, matters, suites, quereles, iudgementes, executions, penalties, and all other thinges not herafter excepted, nor conteyned in any clause of prouiso herafter mencioned, had been particularlye, singularlye, specially, & plainely named, rehearsed, and specified in thys present acte, & also pardoned by propre, and expresse wordes, and names, in theyr kyndes, natures, and qualities, by woordes and termes therunto requisite to haue be put in, & expressed in this act of free pardone. And that his sayed subiectes, nor any of thē, nor theires, executours, or administratours of any of them, nor any of the saied bodies corporate, nor any other persons, bodies politique, or corporate before named, or any of them be, nor shalbe sued, vexed, or inquieted, in theyr bodies, goodes, lādes, or cattalles, for any maner matter, cause, contempt, mysdemeanor, forfaycture, trespasse, offence, or anye other thyng, suffred, doen, or commytted agaynst his highnes, or his croune, dignitie, prerogatiue, lawes, or statutes, but onely for, or concerning such matters, clauses, and offences, as be rehersed, or mencioned in thexcepcions, or clauses of prouiso in thys present acte hereafter mencioned, in such maner, and fourme, as in the same excepcions, or clauses of prouiso be mencioned, and for none other: Anye statute, or statutes, lawes, customes, vses, or presidentes hertofore had, made, or vsed to the contrarye in any wise notwithstandyng. And that all, and euerye the kynges saied subiectes, and all, and singular bodies corporate, and other before rehearsed, may by hym, or them selues, or by his, or their deputie, or deputies, or by his, or their attorney, or attorneis according to the lawes of this realme, pleade, & minister this present act of free pardō for his, or their discharge, of, and for euery thing that is by vertue of thys present acte pardoned, dyscharged, geuen, or graunted, without any fee, or other thing in any wise paying to anye persō, or persones for wryting, or entrie of the iugement, or other cause concernyng
suche plee, writing, or entrie, but onely .xii.d. to be paied to the officer, or clerke, that shall entre the plee, matter, or iudgemēt, for the discharge of any partie so pleading thesame: any statute, lawe, or vse to the contrary in any wise notwithstanding.

And furthermore, the kynges hyghnesse is pleased, and contented, that it be enacted by thaucthoritie of thys present parlament, that thys hys saied free pardō by ye generall wordes before rehersed, shalbe reputed, demed, and iudged, allowed, and taken in all maner of courtes, or elswhere, aswell in the woordes, and clauses of exceptions, and forprises specifyed in thys present acte, as in all, and singular other clauses, woordes, and sentences mencioned, and rehearsed in this his saied free pardone most beneficially, and auaileably to all, and singular hys saied subiectes, bodies corporate, and other before rehearsed, and to euery of them in all thinges ambiguous, and doubtfull, & most strongly in barre and dyscharge against his highnesse, his heires, successours, and executours in euery thing without obstacle, chalenge, or other delay whatsoeuer it shalbe, to be made, pleaded, obiected, or alledged by the kyng our souereigne lorde, his heyres, successours, or executours, or by hys, or any of their generall attourney, or attourneyes, or by any persone, or persones for his highnes, or any of his heyres, successours, or executours.

And furthermore, it is enacted by the kyng our Souereygne Lorde, by thaucthoritie of thys present parlament, that if any officer, or Clerke of any of his highnesse courtes commonly called the kynges bench, the Chaūcerie, the cōmon place, or exchequier, or any other officer, or clerke of any other court within thys realme, or Wales, or other hys highnesse dominions aboue mencioned, at any time after the last day of Ianuarye, in the yere of our Lord God. M.D.xlix. make out, or write out any maner of writtes, or other processe, or any extractes, summones, or other preceptes, whereby any of the saied subiects, or any of the sayed bodies corporate, or other before rehearsed, or anye of them shalbe in anye wyse arrested, attached, dystreined, summoned, or otherwise vexed, inquieted or greued in his, or their bodies, lādes, tenemētes, gooddes, or cattals, or in any of thē, for, or because of any maner of thyng pardoned or dyscharged by vertue of this acte of free pardon, he so offending, and therof lawfully condemned, shall yelde, and paye for the recompence therof to the partie so greued, or offēded, treble damages, the costes of his sute to be accoūpted, as parcell of the damages. And neuerthelesse, all & singular suche writtes, proces, extractes, and preceptes so to be made, for, or vpon any maner thyng pardoned, or dyscharged by this acte of free pardone, shalbe vtterly voyde, and of none effecte.

Except alwayes, and forprised of this generall, and free pardone, all & all maner prepensed, & wilfull murder, and all, and euery robbery cōmitted, or doen in, or nere the high way, & all, and euery wilfull burning of any house, or barne with corne, and all, and euery offence of burgularie,
robbyng of churches, or chappelles, dooen, or perpetrated sithen the feast of Sainct Michael tharchangel last past.
And also except, and forprised out of this free pardon, all, and all maner of piracies, had, doen, committed, or perpetrate vpon, or in the seas.

And also excepted, and forprised out of thys free pardone, all, and all maner of punishmētes, impeticions, forfaitures, peines of death, iudgementes, and executions for the premisses before excepted, or for anye of them.

And excepted, and forprised out of thys free pardon, all, and singular summe, and summes of money, graunted to the kinges hignesse, or hys most derest father kyng Henry the .viii. by waye, and meane of subsidie, fiftene, beneuolence, loane, contribution, reliefe, or otherwyse, or by any of thesame waies, or meanes: And all deteiners, witholdynges, & none paymentes, touching, or concernyng thesame, or any part thereof: And that the same, or euery part thereof may, and shall by auctoritie abouesaied, be leuied, taken, and receiued to the kynges vse, any thing in thys free pardone to the contrary notwithstanding.

And also except, and forprised all wastes of the Kynges wooddes in any of his forrestes, parkes, chases, and elswhere. And also except, and forprised, all, and all maner of wastes committed, or doen in anye of the kinges wardes landes, or in the wardes landes of any committee of the kinges maiestie, or of any of his most noble progenitours committes.

And also except, and forprised out of this free pardon, all, and euery concealmentes of any custome, or subsidie, and all maner of accomptes and accompt, and all actions, suites, impeticions, and demaundes, touching, or concernyng any accomptes, or accompt, & all arrerages of accompt, and all debtes, impeticions, suites, demaundes, & executions by occasiō, or meanes of any accōpt, which ought to be made to hys hyghnes, or to any of hys most noble progenitours. And also excepted & forprised all tytles of actions of Quare impedit, all rauishmētes, & witholding of any of the kinges wardes, or witholding of any wardes lādes, or tenementes, & the profites of the same landes, & tenementes. And all and euery fine, or fines, for the single, or double value of the mariage, or mariages of any of the kinges wardes, at any time growen to the king our souereygne lorde, or to any of hys most noble progenitours.

And also except, & forprised, all, & singular homages, feaulties, & other seruices, reliefes, rentes, seruices, rentes charges, rētes secke, & tenthes, and the arrerages of euerye of them due to hys highnesse, or to anye of his most noble progenitours. And also except, and forprised out of thys free pardon, all, & singuler forfaitures, & all maner of penalties, summes of money, & profites whatsoeuer growen, or due by reason of any offēce or acte cōmitted, or doen contrary to any statute or statutes, or contrary to the common lawes of this realme, wherof any seasure was made, or anye informacion geuen in anye of the kynges Courtes of Recorde, or
any sute cōmenced, or depēding before ye .xx. day of Ianuary in the third yere of ye kynges maiesties reigne, or wherof ye kinges maiestie, or king Henry the .viii. by byll sealed with the seale of any of them, before ye saied xx. day of Ianuary in the sayed yere of our lord God. M.D. xlix. haue, hath, or shall make any gyft, or assignement to any seruaūtes, or seruaūt of our souereigne lorde the kyng, or of the sayed king Henry the eight, or or to any other persone, or persones.

And excepte, and forprised out of this free pardone, all, and singular forfaictures, forfaicture, & summe, and summes of money, beyng due to our souereigne lorde the kyng, or to kyng Henry the .vii. or to king Hēry theight, by any penall statute, or statutes, whiche be conuerted into the nature of debt by iudgement, or by agrement of thoffendour.

And except, and forprised out of this free pardon, all, and all maner of debtes due, & to be due to our souereigne lorde the kyng, or to any of his most noble progenitors, other thē such as are due to our souereigne lord the king, vpon any obligation, or recognisaūce forfaited for none apparance, or for not keping of the peace, or for not being of good behauour.

And except, and forprised out of this free pardon, all, and singular fines, aswell fines pro licētia concordandi, as other fines for contēptes, or offences set, or taxed. And also all issues, fines, and amerciamētes, aswell reall, as other vnder .v. l (other then fines for any alienation, without the kinges lycence) seuerall, or particularly, concerning any one persone, or mo persones ioinctlye, whether the same fines, or amerciamentes before excepted, be totted, or not totted, taken to the charge of anye sheriefe, or sheriefes, or not taken to his, or theyr charge, extreated, or not extreated whether they be turned into debt, or not turned into debt, or not beyng leuied, receiued, or not receiued, by any sheriefe, or sheriefes, baylife, minister, or other officer.

Prouyded alwaies and be it enacted by thaucthoritie aforesaied, that this present acte of free pardon, or any thing therein conteined, shal not in any wise extende to discharge, or pardon any offence, peine, or penaltie, dooen, commytted, or forfaycted, by force of anye estatute heretofore made, against the decaying of any house, or houses of husbandry, or cōuerting of any lande from Tyllage into pasture, otherwise, or in any other maner then to pardon, or dyscharge all issues, forfeyctes, peynes; & penalties growen, or due to the kinges maiestie, or to hys late father of most famous memorye kyng Henrye the eyght, before the fyrst daye of Iune, in the yere of our lorde God, a thowsande, fyue hundred & fifty, by reason of any suche offence, or offences, whiche issues, forfaictes, peynes, or penalties are playnely, and clearely before pardoned, in, and by this present acte of free pardone, nor shall extende to geue, or make any lycence, or dispensacion to any persone, or persones, to holde, or continue the same so decayed, or conuerted, contrary to the fourme of any estatute or estatutes.

Prouyded also, and be it enacted by thaucthoritie of this present parlpment, that all, and euery persone, and persones, whiche tended to sue liuerie out of the Kynges handes, or that ought to sue any liuerie out of the Kynges handes, or that ought to sue any Ouster le mayn of any manours, landes, tenementes, or hereditamētes, whatsoeuer they be, shall sue, and be bounden to sue his, or their liuerie, or liueries, and Ouster le mayn, of his, or their manours, landes, tenementes, or hereditamentes as they ought, or should haue doen, if this acte of free pardon had neuer been graūted, any article, clause, matter, or sentence, acte, or actes, thing or thinges in this present acte of free pardon comprised, or specified, to the contrary in any wise notwithstanding.

And except, and forprised out of this free pardone, all, and singular persone, and persones, beyng the .xxvi. day of Ianuarye, in the yere of our Lorde God. M.D.xlix. prisoner, or prisoners in the tower of London, in the Flete, in the Mershalsie, or in any other prison, or in any wise by the kynges commaundement, or by the commaundement, or ordre of the Lordes of hys priuie counsaile, restreygned, or stayed from libertie other then suche prisoner, and prisoners, as are in any prison, onely for felonious stealyng of anye gooddes, or Cattalles vnder the summe, and value of .xx.s. so that the same felonious takyng of, & such gooddes, or cattalles, be not feloniously taken, in, or nere anye hygh waye, nor in the dwelling house of any persone in the night time, nor in any churche, or chappell.

And also except out of this free pardone, all and singular persone, and persones, which at any time before the sayed .xxvi. daye of Ianuarye, in the sayed yere of our Lorde God. M.D.xlix. is, ought, or shalbe put to death, or in execucion by vertue of any maner of iudgemēt against him or them geuen.

And except, and forprised out of this free pardon, all, and all maner of treasons, doen, cōmitted, or perpetrated by anye persone, or persones, in any of ye parties beyond the sea, or in Scotlāde, or by anye persō, or persones now being beyond the sea, or in Scotlande, other then such treasons, or petit treasons, as haue been commytted, perpetrated, or dooen, by any persone being beyonde the sea, or in Scotlande, that before the feast of thassencion of our lord God, that shalbe in the yere of our lorde God. M.D.L. shall come, and make their returne, and repaire into this realme of Englande. And except and forprised all impetitions, punishementes, forfaictures, peynes of death, executions, and iudgementes for the same treasons.

And furthermore, the kynges Maiestie of hys speciall Grace, and clemencie, is pleased, and contented, that it be enacted, and established by thaucthoritie aforesaied, that all, and singular persone, and persones beyng borne within this Realme of Englande, or in any of the kynges dominions, and now being beyonde the Sea, or in Scotlande, which
before the fyrst day of Nouembre in the yere of our Lorde God, a thousande fiue hundred fourtie and nine, did flie out of this Realme of Englande, or any of the kinges dominions, for any high treason, petit treason, misprision of treason, or for any felonie, or murdre, or other crime, or offence by him, or them committed, in any wise doen, or perpetrated shal by vertue of this free pardon bee clerely discharged, acquited, and pardoned, of all, and all maner of treasons, petit treasones, misprision of treason, or other offences, and crimes whatsoeuer doen, committed, or perpetrated, before thesaied first daie of Nouēbre, in the saied yere of our Lorde God a thousande fiue hundred fourtie, and nine, & of al maner of impeticions, sutes, penalties, forfaictures, and executions for the same, So that he, or they do come, and make their retourne, and repaire into this realme of Englande, on thisside thesaied feast of Thassencion of our lorde God, in thesaied yere of our lorde God, M.D.L. And also our saied Souereigne Lord the king by vertue of this acte, and by the aucthorttie abouesaied, doeth geue aucthoritie and licence to all, and euery of the saied persone, and persons being beyond the sea, or in Scotlande, to retourne, and repaire into this realme of England, and other hys dominions before thesame feast of Thassencion of our Lorde God M.D.L.

Prouyded alwayes, and be it enacted by the aucthoritie aforesaied, that it shalbe lawfull to all, and euery clerke, and other officer of anye of the kynges courtes, to whome it apperteineth, without any forfaicture, losse, or punishement for the same, to awarde and make writtes of Capias vtlegatum, at the suite of the partie playntife agaynst anye persone, or persones, being outlawed in any action, or sute, to the entent to compell the persone or persones so outlawed, to make aunswere to the plaintife, or plaintifes, at whose sute, he, or they were, or was outlawed. And also that euery persone and persones now being outlawed, shalbe bounden to sue a Scire facias against ye parties, or parties, at whose suite, he or they were, or was outlawed, or theyr executours, or administratours before such time as the persone, or persones so outlawed shall take any aduaūtage of thys free pardone, concerning hys, or theyr outlawrye.

And the king our souereigne lorde is contented, and pleased to graūt by aucthoritie afore sayed, that it shalbe lawfull to all, & singuler Archbyshoppes, and byshoppes of thys realme of Englande, and Wales, to deliuer out of prisone, and set at libertie all, and singuler those persones beyng in prisone in theyr custodie, or in the custodie of anye of them, as Clerkes conuicte, or conuicted, whiche be pardoned by this acte of free pardone without any further acte, or suite to be made for allowaunce of thys pardone, or otherwise, any acte of parlament, law, vsage, custome, or other thyng to the contrary, in any wise notwithstandyng.

Prouyded alway, that this acte of generall, and free pardon, or anye thing therin conteyned, extende not to Iohn Wythe of Eylisham in the
countie of Norff. any thing in thys acte to the contrary in any wise notwithstanding.

Prouided also, and be it enacted by thaucthoritie aforesaied, that this acte of free Pardon shall not extende to any persone, or persones, which at any time hertofore haue offended in these heresies, & erronious opinions herafter ensuyng, that is to saye, that infantes ought not to be baptized, and if they be baptized, they ought to be rebaptized whē they come to lawfull age. That it is not lefull for a christien man to beare office, or rule in the common wealth. That no mans lawes ought to be obeyed, that it is not leful for a christien man to take an oathe before any Iudge that Christ tooke no bodily substaūce of our blessed ladie: That synners after baptisme cannot be restored by repentaunce. That all thynges be or ought to be common, and nothing seuerall.

Prouyded alwaies, and it is enacted by thaucthoritie aforesaied, that this Acte of free pardon, or any thing therin conteined, shall not in any wyse extende, or be in any wise beneficiall, or take effecte to anye suche persone, or persones, that at any time sythe the feast of Easter last past hath, or haue made any rebellion, or vnlawfull commotion, in any part of thys Realme, or in Wales, whiche at anye tyme syth the .xii. daye of Iune last past, hath, or haue commenced, or sued, and after the last day of February next comming will folow, or continue, or that at any time herafter, shall commence, or sue in propre persone, or by hys, or their attourneye aucthorised, auowe, sue, & folowe, any maner of appeale touching the death of any such rebellious person, or persones, the maiming or beatyng of any of the saied rebellious persone, or persones, or any bill or billes, acciō, or accions of trespasse, or detinue, or action vpon the case agaynst any persone, or persones, that dyd serue the kinges maiestie in, or for the subduyng of the sayed rebellious persones, of, for, or concernyng the taking away, or witholdyng of the goodes, or of Cattalles, any of the sayed rebellious persones, or of, for, or concerning any other acte, or actes personall, doen, or executed in the commoncion time to any of the sayed rebellious persones, by any persone, or persones that serued the king in the commocion time, in the subduing of the same rebellious persones betwene the saied .xii. daye of Iune, and the fyrst day of Nouembre last past.
¶ Imprinted at London by Richard Grafton, printer to the Kynges Maiestie. 1553
Cum priuilegio ad imprimendum solum.
